  5583                                          ; 25/06/2019

  5972                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5973                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5974                                  ;
  5975                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5976                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5977                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.

  5980                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  6524 0000095D EBEE                    	jmp	short win386_done	; return with the size
  6525                                  
  6526                                  ; 05/01/2024
  6527                                  %if 0
  6528                                  win386_inst:
  6529                                  	; WIN386 check to see if DOS has identified the CDS,SFT and device
  6530                                  	; chain as instance data. Currently, we let the WIN386 DOSMGR handle
  6531                                  	; this by returning a status of not previously instanced. The basic
  6532                                  	; structure of these things have not changed and so the current
  6533                                  	; DOSMGR code should be able to work it out
  6534                                  
  6535                                  	xor	dx,dx			; make sure dx has a not done value
  6536                                  	jmp	short PopIret		; skip done indication

  6553                                  
  6554                                  ; 15/05/2019
  6555                                  
  6556                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6557                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6558                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6559                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6560                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6561                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6562                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6563                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6564                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6565                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6566                                  
  6567                                  getwinlast:
  6568                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6569 0000095F 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6570 00000963 4E                      	dec	si
  6571 00000964 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6572 00000966 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6573 0000096B C3                      	retn
  6574                                  
  6575                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6576                                  %if 0
  6577                                  winold_swap:
  6578                                  	push	ds
  6579                                  	push	es
  6580                                  	push	si
  6581                                  	push	di
  6582                                  	push	cx
  6583                                  
  6584                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6585                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6586                                  
  6587                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6588                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6589                                  	call	getwinlast
  6590                                  	push	ds
  6591                                  	pop	es
  6592                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6593                                  	xor	si,si
  6594                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6595                                  	mov	cx,8
  6596                                  	cld
  6597                                  	push	cx
  6598                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6599                                  	pop	cx
  6600                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6601                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6602                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6603                                  swapin:
  6604                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6605                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6606                                  	call	getwinlast
  6607                                  	mov	es,si
  6608                                  	xor	di,di
  6609                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6610                                  	mov	cx,8
  6611                                  	cld
  6612                                  	push	cx
  6613                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6614                                  	pop	cx
  6615                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6616                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6617                                  winold_done:
  6618                                  	pop	cx
  6619                                  	pop	di
  6620                                  	pop	si
  6621                                  	pop	es
  6622                                  	pop	ds
  6623                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6624                                  
  6625                                  %endif
  6626                                  
  6627                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6628                                  
  6629                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  6630                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS)
  6631                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4811h
  6632                                  
  6633                                  	; INT 2Fh AX=1231h
  6634                                  	; Windows95 - SET/CLEAR "REPORT WINDOWS TO DOS PROGRAMS" FLAG
  6635                                  	; 			(Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List)
  6636                                  int_2Fh_1231h:

  6641 00000976 7507                    	jnz	short not_1231_dl_0
  6642 00000978 C606[5C0F]01            	mov	byte [IsWin386+1],1	; set byte after "IsWIN386" to 01h
  6643 0000097D EB1A                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6644                                  
  6645                                  	;nop
  6646

  6649 00000982 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_1	; clear "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6650 00000984 800E[5B0F]02            	or	byte [IsWin386],2	; set "IsWIN386" bit 1
  6651 00000989 EB0E                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn
  6652                                  
  6653                                  	;nop
  6654                                  
  6655                                  not_1231_dl_1:

  6657 0000098E 7507                    	jne	short not_1231_dl_2

  6659 00000995 EB02                    	jmp	short int_2f_1231h_retn

  6662 00000998 F9                      	stc
  6663                                  int_2f_1231h_retn:
  6664 00000999 1F                      	pop	ds
  6665 0000099A C3                      	retn

  6903                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6904                                  ; DOSCODE:47F4h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6905                                  ; DOSCODE:47E7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) - 05/11/2022 -
  6906                                  
  6907                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6908                                  
  6909                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6910                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6911                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6912                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6913                                  
  6914                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6915                                  CANCHAR:
  6916 00000A93 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6917                                  	
  6918                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6919                                  ESCCHAR:
  6920 00000A94 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6921                                  	
  6922                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6923                                  
  6924                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6925                                  
  6926                                  	;IF	IBM
  6927 00000A95 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6928 00000A96 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6929 00000A97 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6930 00000A98 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6931 00000A99 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6932 00000A9A 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6933 00000A9B 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6934 00000A9C 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6935 00000A9D 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6936 00000A9E 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6937 00000A9F 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6938 00000AA0 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6939 00000AA1 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6940 00000AA2 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6941                                  	;ENDIF
  6942                                  
  6943                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6944                                  
  6945                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6946                                  
  6947                                  ESCFUNC: ; LABEL WORD
  6948                                  	
  6949 00000AA3 [DF19]                  	short_addr  GETCH	; Ignore the escape sequence
  6950 00000AA5 [5C1A]                  	short_addr  TWOESC
  6951 00000AA7 [511B]                  	short_addr  EXITINS
  6952 00000AA9 [511B]                  	short_addr  ENTERINS
  6953 00000AAB [571A]                  	short_addr  BACKSP
  6954 00000AAD [3D1B]                  	short_addr  REEDIT
  6955 00000AAF [441A]                  	short_addr  KILNEW
  6956 00000AB1 [D31A]                  	short_addr  COPYLIN
  6957 00000AB3 [051B]                  	short_addr  SKIPSTR

  6965                                  
  6966                                  ; DOSMES.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  6967                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6968                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6969                                  
  6970                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6971                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6972                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6973                                  ;
  6974                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6975                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6976                                  ;           the following labels:
  6977                                  ;
  6978                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6979                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6980                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6981                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6982                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6983                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6984                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6985                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6986                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6987                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6988                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6989                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line
  6990                                  ;           CtrlZ       - place a ^Z into the template
  6991                                  ; Registers that are allowed to be modified by this function are:
  6992                                  ;           AX, CX, BP
  6993                                  
  6994                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6995                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6996                                  ; DOSCODE:4820h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6997                                  
  6998                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6999                                  ; -------------------------------------
  7000                                  ; DOSCODE:4813h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7001                                  
  7002                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  7003                                  ; -------------------------------------
  7004                                  ; DOSCODE:4967h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7005                                  
  7006                                  OEMFunctionKey:
  7007 00000ABF E8800E                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; Get the second byte of the sequence
  7008 00000AC2 B10E                    	MOV     CL,ESCTABLEN ; 14	; length of table for scan
  7009 00000AC4 57                      	PUSH    DI                      ; save DI (cannot change it!)
  7010 00000AC5 BF[950A]                	MOV     DI,ESCTAB		; offset of second byte table
  7011 00000AC8 06                      	push	es
  7012 00000AC9 0E                      	push	cs
  7013 00000ACA 07                      	pop	es
  7014 00000ACB F2AE                    	REPNE   SCASB                   ; Look it up in the table
  7015 00000ACD 07                      	pop	es
  7016 00000ACE 5F                      	POP     DI                      ; restore DI
  7017 00000ACF D1E1                    	SHL     CX,1                    ; convert byte offset to word
  7018 00000AD1 89CD                    	MOV     BP,CX                   ; move to indexable register
  7019                                  	;JMP	word [BP+ESCFUNC]	; Go to the right routine
  7020 00000AD3 2EFFA6[A30A]            	JMP	word [CS:BP+ESCFUNC]
  7021                                  
  7022                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS
  7023

  7183                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------
  7184                                  ; Date16 returns the current date in AX, current time in DX
  7185                                  ;   AX - YYYYYYYMMMMDDDDD  years months days

  7483                                  ;TITLE	GETSET - GETting and SETting MS-DOS system calls
  7484                                  ;NAME	GETSET
  7485                                  
  7486                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'

  7503                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Version -- Return MSDOS version number>
  7504                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7505                                  
  7506                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7507                                  ; DOSCODE:4A0Fh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7508                                  
  7509                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7510                                  ; DOSCODE:4B5Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7511                                  
  7512                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7513                                  
  7514                                  ; Inputs:
  7515                                  ;       None
  7516                                  ; Function:
  7517                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7518                                  ; Outputs:
  7519                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7520                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7521                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7522                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7523                                  
  7524                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7525                                  ;
  7526                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7527                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7528                                  ;
  7529                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7530                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7531                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7532                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7533                                  ;		 
  7534                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7535                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7536                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7537                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7538                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7539                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7540                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7541                                  
  7542                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7543 00000C9C 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7544 00000CA1 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7545                                  
  7546                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, offset 196Dh)
  7547                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7548                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)
  7549                                  
  7550 00000CA3 16                              PUSH    SS
  7551 00000CA4 1F                              POP     DS
  7552                                          
  7553                                  	; 06/01/2024
  7554                                  	;MOV	BX,[USERNUM+2]
  7555                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7556                                  
  7557                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7558                                  
  7559                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7560                                  	;DOS flags
  7561                                  
  7562 00000CA5 3C01                    	cmp	AL,1
  7563 00000CA7 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7564                                  
  7565                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7566                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7567                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7568                                  ;else
  7569 00000CA9 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7570                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7571                                  
  7572                                  Norm_Vers:
  7573                                  	;MOV	AX,[MSVERS]  ; MSDOS 3.3
  7574                                  
  7575                                          	; MSDOS 6.0	; MSVERS is a label in TABLE segment	
  7576                                  	; 26/06/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  7577                                  	;	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7578                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7579                                  	;push	ds		; Get the version number from the
  7580 00000CAB 8E1E[3003]              	mov	ds,[CurrentPDB]	; current app's PSP segment
  7581                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]
  7582 00000CAF A14000                  	mov	ax,[PDB.Version] ; AX = DOS version number	
  7583                                  	; 07/12/2022
  7584                                  	;pop	ds
  7585 00000CB2 E8C2F7                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  7586                                  				; Put values for return registers
  7587                                  				; in the proper place on the user's	 
  7588                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI
  7589                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7590                                  gdrvfspc_ret:
  7591                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  7592 00000CB5 8904                            MOV	[SI],AX
  7593                                          ;MOV	[SI+4],CX
  7594 00000CB7 894C04                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  7595                                  set_user_bx:
  7596                                  	;MOV	[SI+2],BX
  7597 00000CBA 895C02                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  7598                                  
  7599 00000CBD C3                      	RETN
  7600

  7604                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7635                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7636                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7637                                  ;
  7638                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7639                                  ;
  7640                                  ; Inputs:
  7641                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7642                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7643                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7644                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7645                                  ;	INT	21
  7646                                  ; Function:
  7647                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7648                                  ; Outputs:
  7649                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7650                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7651                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7652                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7653                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7654                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7655                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7656                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7657                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7658                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7659                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7660                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7661                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7662                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7663                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7664                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7665                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7666                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7667                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7668                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7669                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7670                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7671                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7672                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7673                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7674                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7675                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7676                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7677                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7678                                  ;	  Carry:
  7679                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7680                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7681                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7682                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7683                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7684                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7685                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7686                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7687                                  ;	  Carry:
  7688                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7689                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7690                                  
  7691                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7692                                  
  7693                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7694                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7695                                  
  7696                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7697                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7698                                  
  7699                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7700                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7701                                  
  7702                                  _$INTERNATIONAL:  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), offset 1992h
  7703                                  	 
  7704 00000CCA 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  7705 00000CCC 7404                    	JZ	short BX_HAS_CODE	; -1 means country code is in BX
  7706 00000CCE 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL			; Put AL country code in BX
  7707 00000CD0 30FF                    	XOR	BH,BH

  7898                                  			; GET/SET INTERNATIONALIZATION INFORMATION
  7899                                  			; ****
  7900                                  			; AL = subfunction
  7901                                  			; 00h SET general internationalization info
  7902                                  			;    CX = buffer size (up to 38 bytes)

  7907                                  			;    CX = number of bytes to set (up to 58 bytes)
  7908                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7909                                  			; 02h GET extended internationalization info
  7910                                  			;    CX = buffer size in bytes (up to 58 bytes used)

  7960                                  ;BREAK <$GetExtCntry - return extended country-dependent information>

  7962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7963                                  ;
  7964                                  ; Procedure Name : $GetExtCntry
  7965                                  ;
  7966                                  ; Inputs:
  7967                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7968                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7969                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length
  7970                                  ;	      22H    capitalize ASCIIZ string
  7971                                  ;	      23H    YES/NO check, DL=1st char DH= 2nd char (DBCS)
  7972                                  ;	      80H bit 0 = use normal upper case table
  7973                                  ;		      1 = use file upper case table
  7974                                  ;	   DS:DX points to string
  7975                                  ;
  7976                                  ;	else
  7977                                  ;
  7978                                  ;	MOV	AH,GetExtCntry	 ; DOS 3.3
  7979                                  ;	MOV	AL,INFO_ID	( info type,-1 selects all )
  7980                                  ;	MOV	BX,CODE_PAGE	( -1 = active code page )
  7981                                  ;	MOV	DX,COUNTRY_ID	( -1 = active country )
  7982                                  ;	MOV	CX,SIZE 	( amount of data to return )
  7983                                  ;	LES	DI,COUNTRY_INFO ( buffer for returned data )
  7984                                  ;	INT	21
  7985                                  ; Function:
  7986                                  ;	give users extended country dependent information
  7987                                  ;	or capitalize chars
  7988                                  ; Outputs:
  7989                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7990                                  ;	     extended country info is succesfully returned
  7991                                  ;	  Carry:
  7992                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7993                                  ;	     AX=0, NO	 for YES/NO CHECK
  7994                                  ;		1, YES
  7995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7996

  8429                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Drive_Freespace -- Return bytes of free disk space on a drive>
  8430                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8431                                  ;**	$Get_Drive_Freespace - Return amount of drive free space
  8432                                  ;
  8433                                  ;	$Get_Drive_Freespace returns the # of free allocation units on a
  8434                                  ;		drive.
  8435                                  ;
  8436                                  ;	This call returns the same info in the same registers (except for the

  8591                                  ;BREAK <$Get/Set_Interrupt_Vector - Get/Set interrupt vectors>

  8620                                  ;	M004, M068: Also set A20OFF_COUNT to 1 if EXECA20OFF bit has been set 
  8621                                  ;	and if A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero. See under tag M003 in inc\dossym.inc

  8650 00000F92 7505                    	jnz	short siv_2		 ; N: done

  8668                                  ;	BREAK <$Char_Oper - hack on paths, switches so that xenix can look like PCDOS>
  8669                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8670                                  
  8671                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8672                                  ;
  8673                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8674                                  ;
  8675                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8676                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8677                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8678                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8679                                  ;			Always returns available
  8680                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8681                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8682                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8683                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8684                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8685                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8686                                  ;
  8687                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8688                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8689                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8690                                  
  8691                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8692                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8693                                  
  8694                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8695                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8696                                  
  8697                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8698                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8699 00000FA5 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8700 00000FA7 B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8701 00000FA9 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8702 00000FAB 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8703 00000FAD B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8704 00000FAF 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8705 00000FB1 C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8706                                  
  8707                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8708                                  ; value to return
  8709                                  
  8710                                  chop_1:
  8711 00000FB2 E8C2F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8712 00000FB5 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8713 00000FB8 C3                      	retn
  8714                                  
  8715                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  8716                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987
  8717                                  	;push	ss
  8718                                  	;pop	ds
  8719                                  	;cmp	al,1
  8720                                  	;jb	short chop_1
  8721                                  	;jz	short chop_2
  8722                                  	;cmp	al,3
  8723                                  	;jb	short chop_3
  8724                                  	;jz	short chop_5

  8741                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8742                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8743                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8744                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8745                                  ;
  8746                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8747                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8748                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8749                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8750                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8751                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8752                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8753                                  
  8754                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8755                                  
  8756                                  _$GetExtendedError:
  8757 00000FB9 16                      	push	ss
  8758 00000FBA 1F                      	pop	ds
  8759 00000FBB A1[2403]                	MOV	AX,[EXTERR]
  8760 00000FBE C43E[2803]              	LES	DI,[EXTERRPT]
  8761 00000FC2 8B1E[2603]              	MOV	BX,[EXTERR_ACTION]	; BL = Action, BH = Class
  8762 00000FC6 8A2E[2303]              	MOV	CH,[EXTERR_LOCUS]
  8763 00000FCA E8AAF4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8764                                  	;mov	[si+0Ah],di
  8765 00000FCD 897C0A                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DI],DI
  8766                                  
  8767                                  	; 09/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  8768                                  	;;mov	[si+10h],es
  8769                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_ES],ES
  8770                                  	;;mov	[si+2],bx
  8771                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  8772 00000FD0 E89FFF                  	call	set_user_es_bx
  8773                                  
  8774                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  8775 00000FD3 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  8776                                  jmp_SYS_RET_OK:
  8777                                  	; 15/12/2022
  8778                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
  8779                                  	; 25/06/2019
  8780 00000FD6 E998F6                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK_clc ; 15/12/2022
  8781                                  	; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  8782                                  ;jmp_SYS_RET_OK:
  8783                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
  8784

  8803                                  ;BREAK	<ECS_call - Extended Code System support function>
  8804                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8805                                  ; Inputs:
  8806                                  ;	AL = 0	get lead byte table
  8807                                  ;		on return DS:SI has the table location
  8808                                  ;

  8810                                  ;		DL = flag (00H or 01H)
  8811                                  ;		no return

  9356                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9357                                  ;
  9358                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9359                                  ;
  9360                                  ;   Modification history:
  9361                                  ;
  9362                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9363                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9364                                  ;
  9365                                  
  9366                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9367                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9368                                  ; Inputs:
  9369                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9370                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9371                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9372                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9373                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9374                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9375                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9376                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9377                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9378                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9379                                  ; Function:
  9380                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9381                                  ; Returns:
  9382                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9383                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9384                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9385                                  
  9386                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9387                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9388                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9389                                  
  9390                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9391 000012D2 E8A349                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9392 000012D5 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9393 000012D6 E89EF1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9394                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9395 000012D9 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9396 000012DC C3                      	retn
  9397                                  
  9398                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9399                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9400                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9401

  9441                                  ;
  9442                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9443                                  ;
  9444                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9445                                  ;
  9446                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9447                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9448                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9449                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9450                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9451                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9452                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9453                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9454                                  ;	USES	all
  9455                                  ;
  9456                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9457                                  ;
  9458                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9459                                  ;
  9460                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9461                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9462                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9463                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9464                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9465                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9466                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9467                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9468                                  ;	USES	all
  9469                                  ;
  9470                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9471                                  ;
  9472                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9473                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51E2h
  9474

  9476                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  9480 000012F8 1F                      	pop	ds

  9482 000012F9 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL

  9486                                  	;;mov	al, 0Fh
  9487                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error	;AC000;
  9488                                  	
  9489                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 3.3

  9491                                  
  9492 00001300 E85C20                  	call	DISK_INFO
  9493                                  	;JC	short SET_AL_RET	; User FAILed to I 24

  9496                                  
  9497                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9498                                  	;;;
  9499 00001309 30E4                    	xor     ah, ah		; AH = 0
  9500                                  				; AL = sectors per cluster
  9501 0000130B 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9502 0000130C E81A05                  	call    TestNet
  9503 0000130F 5F                      	pop     di
  9504 00001310 7205                    	jc      short sleazefunc1
  9505 00001312 51                      	push    cx		; bytes per sector
  9506 00001313 E84D21                  	call    modify_cluster_count

  9508                                  				; dx = number of clusters (modified)
  9509                                  				; if bytes per cluster > 16384
  9510                                  				;    and hw of cluster count > 0
  9511                                  				;    bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated parm sign)
  9512                                  sleazefunc1:
  9513                                  	;;;
  9514                                  
  9515                                  ; NOTE THAT A FIXED MEMORY CELL IS USED --> THIS CALL IS NOT
  9516                                  ; RE-ENTRANT. USERS BETTER GET THE ID BYTE BEFORE THEY MAKE THE
  9517                                  ; CALL AGAIN
  9518                                  
  9519                                  	;MOV	DI,FATBYTE
  9520                                  	; 10/01/2024 
  9521                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; AL has sectors/cluster

  9523                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  9524                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9525                                  	;mov	[si+2],di
  9526 0000131A 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  9527 0000131D 895C06                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],BX
  9528                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],DI
  9529                                  	; 10/01/2024

  9534                                  
  9535 00001328 C3                      	retn

 10155                                  setend:
 10156                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10157                                  ;
 10158                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10159                                  	inc	bx
 10160                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10161                                  ;
 10162                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10163                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10164                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10165                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10166                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10167                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10168                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10169                                  ;
 10170                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10171                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10172                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10173                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10174                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10175                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10176                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10177                                  ;
 10178                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10179                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10180                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10181                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10182                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10183                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10184                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10185                                  ;
 10186                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10187                                  
 10188                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10189                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10190                                  ;	  clusters down
 10191                                  
 10192                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10193                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10194                                  
 10195                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10196                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10197                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10198                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10199                                  
 10200                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10201                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10202                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10203                                  
 10204                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10205                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10206                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10207                                  
 10208                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10209                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10210                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10211                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10212                                  	shr	dx,1
 10213                                  
 10214                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10215                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10216                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10217                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10218                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10219                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10220                                  					; number of clusters.
 10221                                  ;cs3 7/2/92

 10224                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10225                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10226                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10227                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10228                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10229                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10230                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10231                                  
 10232                                  setend_fat12:
 10233                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10234                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10235                                  
 10236                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10237                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10238                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10239                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10240                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10241                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10242                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10243                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10244                                  
 10245                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10246                                  
 10247                                  setend_fat16:
 10248                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10249                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10250                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10251                                  
 10252                                  setend_faterr:
 10253                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10254                                  
 10255                                  setend_fat:
 10256                                  
 10257                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10258                                  
 10259                                  ;	end M008
 10260

 10752                                  
 10753                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10754                                  ; Inputs:
 10755                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10756                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10757                                  ; Function:
 10758                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10759                                  ;	specified segment.
 10760                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10761                                  ; Outputs:
 10762                                  ;	DS = DX
 10763                                  ;	ES = DX
 10764                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10765                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10766                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10767                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10768                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10769                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10770                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10771                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10772                                  
 10773                                  SETMEM:
 10774                                  	;XOR	CX,CX

 10776                                  	; cx = 0

 10779                                  	;mov	si,88h
 10780 000016C9 BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate
 10781                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10782 000016CC BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10783                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10784                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10785 000016CF B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10786 000016D1 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10787 000016D3 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10788 000016D7 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10789 000016D9 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10790 000016DC 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10791 000016DE B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10792                                  HAVDIF:
 10793 000016E1 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10794 000016E4 BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10795 000016E7 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10796 000016E9 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10797 000016EB D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10798 000016ED 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10799                                  
 10800                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10801                                  	;
 10802                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10803                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10804                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10805                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10806                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10807                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10808                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10809                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10810                                  	; into the PSP.
 10811                                  	;
 10812                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10813                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10814                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10815                                  	; for all cases.
 10816                                  	;
 10817                                  
 10818                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10819                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10820                                  
 10821 000016EF A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10822 000016F2 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10823                                  
 10824                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10825 000016F6 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10826                                  					;    memory left
 10827 000016F9 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10828                                  					;    OK
 10829                                  					; N: 
 10830                                  
 10831 000016FB C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10832 00001701 C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10833                                  addr_ok:
 10834                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10835 00001707 C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10836                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10837 0000170D C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10838                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10839 00001712 C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10840                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10841 00001718 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10842                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10843 0000171D C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10844                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10845 00001723 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10846                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10847 00001727 C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10848                                  ;
 10849                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10850                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10851                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10852                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10853                                  ; initialize this pointer.

 10871                                  ;BREAK <$GSetMediaID -- get set media ID>
 10872                                  
 10873                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10874                                  ; Inputs:

 10876                                  ;	AL= 0 get media ID
 10877                                  ;	    1 set media ID
 10878                                  ;	DS:DX= buffer containing information
 10879                                  ;		DW  0  info level (set on input)
 10880                                  ;		DD  ?  serial #
 10881                                  ;		DB  11 dup(?)  volume id
 10882                                  ;		DB   8 dup(?)  file system type
 10883                                  ; Function:
 10884                                  ;	Get or set media ID
 10885                                  ; Returns:
 10886                                  ;	carry clear, DS:DX is filled
 10887                                  ;	carry set, error
 10888                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10889

 10994                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10995                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10996                                  ;
 10997                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10998                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10999                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 11000                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 11001                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 11002                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11003                                  
 11004                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11005                                  
 11006                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 11007                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 11008                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 11009                                  StrCmp:
 11010 0000178F 56                      	push	si
 11011 00001790 57                      	push	di
 11012 00001791 50                      	push	ax
 11013                                  Cmplp:
 11014 00001792 AC                      	LODSB
 11015 00001793 E81546                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 11016 00001796 E86546                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 11017 00001799 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 11018 0000179B 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 11019 0000179E 47                      	INC	DI
 11020 0000179F E80946                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 11021 000017A2 E85946                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 11022 000017A5 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 11023 000017A7 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 11024                                  
 11025 000017A9 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 11026 000017AB 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 11027                                  PopRet:
 11028 000017AD 58                      	pop	ax
 11029 000017AE 5F                      	pop	di
 11030 000017AF 5E                      	pop	si
 11031 000017B0 C3                      	retn
 11032

 11036                                  ;   Strcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI and make uppercase
 11037                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 11038                                  ;	characters.
 11039                                  ;
 11040                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - pointer to source string
 11041                                  ;		ES:DI - pointer to destination string
 11042                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string

 11173                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11175                                  ;
 11176                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11177                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11178                                  ;
 11179                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11180                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11181                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11182                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11183                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11184                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11185                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11186                                  
 11187                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11188 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11189 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11190 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11191 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11192 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11193 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11194                                  endstruc

 11198 000017FF 89E5                    	MOV	BP,SP

 11509                                  
 11510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11511                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11512                                  ;
 11513                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11514                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11515                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11516                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11517                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11518                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11519                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11520                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11521                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11522                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11523                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11524                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11525                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11526                                  
 11527                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11528                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11529                                  
 11530                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11531                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11532                                  
 11533                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11534                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11535                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11536                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11537                                  ;;
 11538                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11539                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11540                                  ;;
 11541                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11542                                  ;;	push	ds
 11543                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11544                                  ;;
 11545                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11546                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11547                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11548                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11549                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11550                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11551                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11552                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 11553                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 11554                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11555                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 11556                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11557                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11558                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11559                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11560                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11561                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;
 11562                                  ;;	LES	DI,DWORD PTR DS:[SI]	     ;AN000;;MS. get msg addr
 11563                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;
 11564                                  ;;	POP	SI			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11565                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11566                                  ;;
 11567                                  ;;	pop	ds
 11568                                  
 11569                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11570                                  
 11571                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11572                                  ;	retn	; 29/04/2019
