 14348                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14350                                  ;
 14351                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14352                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14353                                  ;   at 0.
 14354                                  ;
 14355                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14356                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14357                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14358                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14359                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14360                                  ;
 14361                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14362                                  ;
 14363                                  
 14364                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14365                                  ResetLRU:
 14366                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14367                                  	; DOSDATA
 14368                                  
 14369 00001F12 B80080                  	MOV	AX,8000h
 14370 00001F15 06                      	push	es
 14371 00001F16 57                      	push	di
 14372                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; get pointer to head
 14373 00001F17 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14374                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14375 00001F1C 268B4D04                	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 14376                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14377 00001F20 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 14378                                  ovScan:
 14379 00001F23 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
 14380 00001F26 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop
 14381 00001F28 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; truncate at 0
 14382                                  ovLoop:
 14383                                  	;;add	di,53	; MSDOS 3.3
 14384                                  	;add	di,59	; MSDOS 6.0	
 14385 00001F2B 83C73B                  	ADD	DI,SF_ENTRY.size	; advance to next
 14386 00001F2E E2F3                    	LOOP	ovScan
 14387 00001F30 5F                      	pop	di
 14388 00001F31 07                      	pop	es
 14389 00001F32 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX
 14390 00001F35 C3                      	retn

 14437                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14438                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.

 14661                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14662                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14664                                  ;
 14665                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 14666                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 14667                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 14668                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 14669                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 14670                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 14671                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 14672                                  ;
 14673                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 14674                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 14675                                  ;
 14676                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 14677                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 14678                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 14679                                  ;
 14680                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 14681                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 14682                                  ;
 14683                                  ; Registers affected: None
 14684                                  ;
 14685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14686                                  
 14687                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 14688                                  LRUFCB:
 14689                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14690                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 14691                                  
 14692                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14693                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 14694                                  
 14695                                  	; 20/01/2024 Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMMDOS.COM)
 14696                                  	; DOSCODE:5E7Ch (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 14697                                  
 14698 00001F36 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14699                                  	
 14700 00001F37 E81EE5                  	call	save_world
 14701                                  	
 14702                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 14703 00001F3A 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14704                                  
 14705 00001F3F 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 14706 00001F41 7516                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 14707                                  
 14708                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 14709                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 14710                                  
 14711                                  	; 20/01/2024

 14714                                  	;jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one

 14717                                  
 14718 00001F43 C43E[760F]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 14719                                  
 14720                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14721 00001F47 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 14722 00001F49 09F9                    	or	cx,di		; is address == 0?
 14723 00001F4B 740C                    	jz	short lru1	; invalid local SFT, find one
 14724                                  
 14725                                  gotlocalSFT:
 14726 00001F4D 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 14727 00001F51 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 14728 00001F55 F8                      	clc
 14729 00001F56 E9A900                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 14730                                  
 14731                                  lru1:
 14732 00001F59 C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 14733                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14734 00001F5D 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 14735                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14736 00001F61 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 14737                                  
 14738                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 14739                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 14740                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 14741                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 14742                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14743                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 14744                                  
 14745 00001F64 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 14746 00001F67 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 14747 00001F69 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx

 14749                                  
 14750                                  findSFT:
 14751                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 14752 00001F6D 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0

 14754 00001F71 744C                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 14755                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 14756                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 14757 00001F73 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 14758 00001F77 7446                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 14759                                  
 14760                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 14761                                  	; used for a later regen.
 14762                                  
 14763                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14764                                  	; 08/11/2022
 14765                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 14766 00001F79 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h

 14768                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h

 14771                                  
 14772                                  ;IF installed
 14773 00001F80 E8CB64                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 14774                                  ;ENDIF
 14775 00001F83 752C                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14776                                  
 14777                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 14778                                  
 14779                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 14780                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 14781                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 14782                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since

 14786                                  hackpoint:

 14788 00001F89 8C06[780F]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14789                                  
 14790 00001F8D 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 14791 00001F8F 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 14792                                  
 14793                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 14794                                  	
 14795                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14796 00001F91 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14797 00001F95 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 14798                                  
 14799                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14800 00001F97 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14801 00001F9B 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 14802                                  lru4:
 14803                                  	;add	di,59
 14804 00001F9D 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 14805 00001FA0 E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 14806                                  	
 14807                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14808 00001FA2 49                      	dec	cx ; -1
 14809                                  
 14810                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT
 14811                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 14812                                  
 14813 00001FA3 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 14814                                  	;cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 14815 00001FA5 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx ; 20/01/2024
 14816 00001FA7 7516                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 14817                                  
 14818                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 14819

 14821

 14823                                  	;cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 14824 00001FAD 752D                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 14825                                  noSFT:
 14826                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT.
 14827                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU
 14828                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 14829                                  
 14830 00001FAF EB4E                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 14831                                  
 14832                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14833                                  lru5:
 14834                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 14835 00001FB1 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?

 14837

 14839 00001FB7 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14840

 14842 00001FBD EBDE                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 14843                                  
 14844                                  gotSFT:
 14845 00001FBF 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14846 00001FC1 74C2                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 14847                                  
 14848                                  	; HACK!!!
 14849                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 14850                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint'
 14851                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code
 14852                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 14853                                  
 14854                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 14855                                  ;
 14856                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 14857                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 14858                                  ;

 14860                                  ;
 14861                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14862                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 14863                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 14864                                  ;
 14865                                  ;notlocaluse:
 14866                                  
 14867                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file.
 14868                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN)
 14869                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We
 14870                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously
 14871                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 14872                                  
 14873 00001FC3 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 14874 00001FC5 393E[760F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 14875 00001FC9 750E                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14876 00001FCB 3906[780F]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 14877                                  	;je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 14878                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14879 00001FCF 7508                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14880                                  zerolocalSFT:	
 14881 00001FD1 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14882 00001FD3 A3[760F]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14883 00001FD6 A3[780F]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14884                                  	
 14885                                  notinvalid:
 14886 00001FD9 E971FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14887                                  
 14888                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable.
 14889                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 14890                                  
 14891                                  ;zerolocalSFT:
 14892                                  	;xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14893                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14894                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14895                                  	;
 14896                                  	;jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14897                                  
 14898                                  gotnetSFT:
 14899                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be
 14900                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the
 14901                                  	; LocalSFT variable

 15003                                  	; called from SFTFromFCB. SS already DOSDATA
 15004                                  
 15005                                  	; General data filling. Mode is sf_isFCB + open_for_both, date/time 
 15006                                  	; we do not fill, size we do no fill, position we do not fill,

 15017                                  
 15018                                  	; The FCB is for a network or a sharing based system. At this point 
 15019                                  	; we have already closed the SFT for this guy and reconnection is 
 15020                                  	; impossible.
 15021                                  	;

 15023                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.

 15307                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 15308                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15309                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 15310                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 15311                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 15312                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 15313                                  ;
 15314                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 15315                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 15316                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 15317                                  ;		'C' clear
 15318                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 15319                                  
 15320                                  BlastSFT:
 15321                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15322                                  	;;;
 15323 00002118 E8D729                  	call	SFT_FREE
 15324                                  	;;;
 15325 0000211B 57                      	push	di
 15326                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15327                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15328 0000211C B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 15329 0000211F F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 15330 00002121 5F                      	pop	di
 15331 00002122 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 15332 00002124 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 15333                                  	;mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count    ;
 15334                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 15335 00002127 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 15336 0000212B 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 15337                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 15338 0000212C 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 15339                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 15340 00002130 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;
 15341                                  
 15342                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 15343                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15344                                  ;
 15345                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 15346                                  ;   regenerated.
 15347                                  ;
 15348                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 15349                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 15350                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 15351                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 15352                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX
 15353                                  ;
 15354                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15355                                  
 15356                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15357                                  	; DOSCODE:59F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 15358                                  
 15359                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15360                                  	; DOSCODE:607Eh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15361                                  CheckFCB:
 15362                                  		
 15363                                  	; called from $fcb_open and sftfromfcb. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15364                                  
 15365                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 15366                                  
 15367                                  	; LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]
 15368                                  
 15369                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 15370                                  	
 15371                                  	; SR;
 15372                                  	; We check if the given FCB is for a local file. If so, we return a 
 15373                                  	; bad SFT status forcing the caller to regenerate the SFT.
 15374                                  
 15375                                  	;test	byte [si+19h],0C0h

 15568                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 15569                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15570                                  ;
 15571                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 15572                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 15573                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 15574                                  ;	with PID
 15575                                  ;
 15576                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15577                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 15578                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 15579                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 15580                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 15581                                  ;
 15582                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15583                                  
 15584                                  SFTFromFCB:
 15585                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15586                                  
 15587                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15588                                  
 15589 0000219D 50                      	push	ax
 15590 0000219E 53                      	push	bx
 15591                                  	;mov	al,[si+18h]
 15592 0000219F 8A4418                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn] 	; set SFN for check
 15593 000021A2 E88CFF                  	call	CheckFCB
 15594 000021A5 5B                      	pop	bx
 15595 000021A6 58                      	pop	ax
 15596                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15597                                  	;MOV	[CS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15598 000021A7 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; SS override
 15599 000021AC 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES
 15600 000021B1 7311                    	JNC	short Set_SFT		; no problems, just set thissft
 15601                                  	
 15602                                  	; 09/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0)
 15603                                  	; 31/05/2019

 15683                                  ;**	FCBIO2.ASM - Ancient 1.0 1.1 FCB system calls
 15684                                  ;
 15685                                  ;	GetRR
 15686                                  ;	GetExtent
 15687                                  ;	SetExtent
 15688                                  ;	GetExtended
 15689                                  ;	GetRecSize
 15690                                  ;	FCBIO
 15691                                  ;	$FCB_OPEN
 15692                                  ;	$FCB_CREATE
 15693                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE_BLOCK
 15694                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ_BLOCK
 15695                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_READ
 15696                                  ;	$FCB_SEQ_WRITE
 15697                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_READ
 15698                                  ;	$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE
 15699                                  ;
 15700                                  ;	Revision history:
 15701                                  ;
 15702                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15703                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 15704                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 15705                                  ;				  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 15706                                  ;				  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 15707                                  ;				  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 15708                                  ;		 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 15709                                  ;				  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
 15710                                  ;
 15711                                  ;	    A000   version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 15712                                  
 15713                                  ; Defintions for FCBOp flags
 15714                                  
 15715                                  RANDOM	equ 2				; random operation
 15716                                  FCBREAD equ 4				; doing a read
 15717                                  BLOCK	equ 8				; doing a block I/O
 15718                                  
 15719                                  ;Break <GetRR - return the random record field in DX:AX>
 15720                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15721                                  ;
 15722                                  ;   GetRR - correctly load DX:AX with the random record field (3 or 4 bytes)
 15723                                  ;	from the FCB pointed to by DS:SI
 15724                                  ;
 15725                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to an FCB
 15726                                  ;		BX has record size
 15727                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15728                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15729                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15730                                  
 15731                                  GetRR:
 15732                                  	;mov	ax,[si+21h]
 15733 00002210 8B4421                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR]	; get low order part
 15734                                  	;mov	dx,[si+23h]
 15735 00002213 8B5423                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2]	; get high order part
 15736 00002216 83FB40                  	CMP	BX,64			; ignore MSB of RR if recsiz > 64
 15737 00002219 7202                    	JB	short GetRRBye
 15738                                  GetExtent_bye:	; 21/01/2024
 15739 0000221B 30F6                    	XOR	DH,DH
 15740                                  GetRRBye:
 15741 0000221D C3                      	retn
 15742                                  
 15743                                  ;Break <GetExtent - retrieve next location for sequential IO>
 15744                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15745                                  ;
 15746                                  ;   GetExtent - Construct the next record to perform I/O from the EXTENT and
 15747                                  ;	NR fields in the FCB.
 15748                                  ;
 15749                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - point to FCB
 15750                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15751                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15752                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15753                                  
 15754                                  GetExtent:
 15755                                  	;mov	al,[si+20h]
 15756 0000221E 8A4420                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SYS_FCB.NR]	; get low order piece
 15757                                  	;mov	dx,[si+0Ch]
 15758 00002221 8B540C                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT]	; get high order piece
 15759 00002224 D0E0                    	SHL	AL,1
 15760 00002226 D1EA                    	SHR	DX,1
 15761 00002228 D0D8                    	RCR	AL,1	; move low order bit of DL to high order of AH
 15762 0000222A 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15763 0000222C 88F2                    	MOV	DL,DH
 15764                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15765                                  	;XOR	DH,DH
 15766                                  	;retn
 15767 0000222E EBEB                    	jmp	short GetExtent_bye
 15768                                  
 15769                                  ;Break <SetExtent - update the extent/NR field>
 15770                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15771                                  ;
 15772                                  ;   SetExtent - change the position of an FCB by filling in the extent/NR
 15773                                  ;	fields
 15774                                  ;
 15775                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15776                                  ;		DX:AX is a record location in file
 15777                                  ;   Outputs:	Extent/NR fields are filled in
 15778                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 15779                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15780                                  
 15781                                  SetExtent:
 15782 00002230 50                      	push	ax
 15783 00002231 52                      	push	dx
 15784 00002232 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 15785 00002234 247F                    	AND	AL,7FH			; next rec field
 15786                                  	;mov	[si+20h],al
 15787 00002236 884420                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.NR],AL
 15788 00002239 80E180                  	AND	CL,80H			; save upper bit
 15789 0000223C D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
 15790 0000223E D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1			; move high bit of CX to low bit of DX
 15791 00002240 88E8                    	MOV	AL,CH
 15792 00002242 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15793                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch], ax
 15794 00002244 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; all done
 15795 00002247 5A                      	pop	dx
 15796 00002248 58                      	pop	ax
 15797 00002249 C3                      	retn
 15798                                  
 15799                                  ;Break <GetExtended - find FCB in potential extended fcb>
 15800                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15801                                  ;
 15802                                  ;   GetExtended - Make DS:SI point to FCB from DS:DX
 15803                                  ;
 15804                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 15805                                  ;   Outputs:	DS:SI point to the FCB part
 15806                                  ;		zeroflag set if not extended fcb
 15807                                  ;   Registers modified: SI
 15808                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15809                                  
 15810                                  GetExtended:
 15811 0000224A 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; point to Something
 15812 0000224C 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; look for extention
 15813 0000224F 7503                    	JNZ	short GetBye		; not there
 15814 00002251 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; point to FCB
 15815                                  GetBye:
 15816 00002254 39D6                    	CMP	SI,DX			; set condition codes
 15817                                  getextd_retn:
 15818 00002256 C3                      	retn
 15819                                  
 15820                                  ;Break <GetRecSize - return in BX the FCB record size>
 15821                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15822                                  ;
 15823                                  ;   GetRecSize - return in BX the record size from the FCB at DS:SI
 15824                                  ;
 15825                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to a non-extended FCB
 15826                                  ;   Outputs:	BX contains the record size
 15827                                  ;   Registers modified: None
 15828                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15829                                  
 15830                                  	; 22/01/2024
 15831                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15832                                  GetRecSize:
 15833                                  	;mov	bx,[si+0Eh]
 15834 00002257 8B5C0E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ]	; get his record size
 15835 0000225A 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX			; is it nul?
 15836                                  	;jz	short getextd_retn
 15837                                  	; 22/01/2024 (BugFix)
 15838 0000225C 75F8                    	jnz	short getextd_retn
 15839                                  	;MOV	BX,128			; use default size
 15840 0000225E B380                    	mov	bl,128	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15841                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],bx
 15842 00002260 895C0E                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],BX	; stuff it back
 15843 00002263 C3                      	retn
 15844                                  
 15845                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 15846                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:61B3h
 15847                                  
 15848                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15849                                  
 15850                                  ;BREAK <$FCB_Random_write_Block - write a block of records to a file >
 15851                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15852                                  ;
 15853                                  ;   $FCB_Random_Write_Block - retrieve a location from the FCB, seek to it
 15854                                  ;	and write a number of blocks from it.
 15855                                  ;
 15856                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an FCB
 15857                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = 0 write was successful and the FCB position is updated
 15858                                  ;		AL <> 0 Not enough room on disk for the output
 15859                                  ;
 15860                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15861                                  
 15862                                  _$FCB_RANDOM_WRITE_BLOCK:
 15863                                  	;mov	AL,0Ah	
 15864 00002264 B00A                    	MOV	AL,RANDOM+BLOCK
 15865 00002266 EB12                    	JMP	short FCBIO	; 23/01/2024
 15866                                  
 15867                                  ;BREAK <$FCB_Random_Read_Block - read a block of records to a file >
 15868                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15869                                  ;
 15870                                  ;   $FCB_Random_Read_Block - retrieve a location from the FCB, seek to it
 15871                                  ;	and read a number of blocks from it.
 15872                                  ;
 15873                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an FCB
 15874                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = error codes defined above
 15875                                  ;
 15876                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15877                                  
 15878                                  _$FCB_RANDOM_READ_BLOCK:
 15879                                  	;mov	AL,0Eh	
 15880 00002268 B00E                    	MOV	AL,RANDOM+FCBREAD+BLOCK
 15881 0000226A EB0E                    	JMP	short FCBIO	; 23/01/2024
 15882                                  
 15883                                  ;BREAK <$FCB_Seq_Read - read the next record from a file >
 15884                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 15886                                  ;   $FCB_Seq_Read - retrieve the next record from an FCB and read it into
 15887                                  ;	memory
 15888                                  ;
 15889                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an FCB

 15950                                  ;BREAK <FCBIO - do internal FCB I/O>
 15951                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15952                                  ;
 15953                                  ;   FCBIO - look at FCBOP and merge all FCB operations into a single routine.
 15954                                  ;
 15955                                  ;   Inputs:	FCBOP flags which operations need to be performed
 15956                                  ;		DS:DX point to FCB
 15957                                  ;		CX may have count of number of records to xfer
 15958                                  ;   Outputs:	AL has error code
 15959                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 15960                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15961                                  
 15962                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15963                                  	; DOSCODE:5B17h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15964                                  
 15965                                  	; 23/01/2024
 15966                                  	; DOSCODE:5B2Bh (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 15967                                  
 15968                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15969                                  	; DOSCODE:61C9h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15970                                  
 15971                                  FCBIO:
 15972

 15974                                  FTRIM	EQU	2

 16500 000024BB 26C4450D                	les	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_time]

 16513 000024D1 07                      	pop	es

 16515                                  	
 16516 000024D2 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; convenient zero
 16517                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch],ax
 16518 000024D4 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; point to beginning of file
 16519                                  
 16520                                  ; We must scan the set of FCB SFTs for one that appears to match the current
 16521                                  ; one.	We cheat and use CheckFCB to match the FCBs.
 16522                                  
 16523                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 16524 000024D7 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; get the pointer to head of the list
 16525                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+4]
 16526 000024DC 268A6504                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; get number of SFTs to scan
 16527                                  OpenScan:
 16528                                  	;cmp	al,[si+18h]
 16529 000024E0 3A4418                  	CMP	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn]		; don't compare ourselves
 16530 000024E3 7407                    	JZ	short SkipCheck
 16531 000024E5 50                      	push	ax			; preserve count
 16532 000024E6 E848FC                  	call	CheckFCB		; do they match
 16533 000024E9 58                      	pop	ax			; get count back
 16534 000024EA 7309                    	JNC	short OpenFound		; found a match!
 16535                                  SkipCheck:
 16536 000024EC FEC0                    	INC	AL			; advance to next FCB
 16537 000024EE 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH			; table full?
 16538 000024F0 75EE                    	JNZ	short OpenScan		; no, go for more
 16539                                  OpenDone:
 16540 000024F2 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; return success
 16541 000024F4 C3                      	retn
 16542                                  
 16543                                  ; The SFT at ES:DI is the one that is already in use for this FCB. We set the
 16544                                  ; FCB to use this one. We increment its ref count. We do NOT close it at all.
 16545                                  ; Consider:
 16546                                  ;
 16547                                  ;   open (foo)	delete (foo) open (bar)
 16548                                  ;
 16549                                  ; This causes us to recycle (potentially) bar through the same local SFT as
 16550                                  ; foo even though foo is no longer needed; this is due to the server closing
 16551                                  ; foo for us when we delete it. Unfortunately, we cannot see this closure.
 16552                                  ; If we were to CLOSE bar, the server would then close the only reference to
 16553                                  ; bar and subsequent I/O would be lost to the redirector.
 16554                                  ;
 16555                                  ; This gets solved by NOT closing the sft, but zeroing the ref count
 16556                                  ; (effectively freeing the SFT) and informing the sharer (if relevant) that
 16557                                  ; the SFT is no longer in use. Note that the SHARER MUST keep its ref counts
 16558                                  ; around. This will allow us to access the same file through multiple network
 16559                                  ; connections and NOT prematurely terminate when the ref count on one
 16560                                  ; connection goes to zero.
 16561                                  
 16562                                  OpenFound:
 16563                                  	;mov	[si+18h],al
 16564 000024F5 884418                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_sfn],AL 	; assign with this
 16565 000024F8 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16566                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16567                                  					; remember this new invocation
 16568                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16569                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16570                                  	;;;
 16571 000024FB E82125                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16572                                  	;;;
 16573                                  
 16574                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16575 000024FE 16                      	push	ss
 16576 000024FF 1F                      	pop	ds
 16577                                  	
 16578                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:FCBLRU]		; update LRU counts
 16579 00002500 A1[1000]                	mov	ax,[FCBLRU] ; 24/01/2024
 16580                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 16581 00002503 26894515                	MOV	[ES:DI+sf_LRU],AX
 16582                                  ;
 16583                                  ; We have an FCB sft that is now of no use. We release sharing info and then
 16584                                  ; blast it to prevent other reuse.
 16585                                  ;
 16586                                  	;push	ss
 16587                                  	;pop	ds
 16588                                  	
 16589 00002507 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 16590 0000250B 26FF0D                  	dec	word [es:di]
 16591                                  	;DEC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16592                                  					; free the newly allocated SFT
 16593 0000250E E88E5F                  	call	ShareEnd
 16594 00002511 B043                    	MOV	AL,'C'	 ; 43h
 16595 00002513 E802FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16596 00002516 EBDA                    	JMP	short OpenDone
 16597

 16600                                  ;
 16601                                  ;   $FCB_Create - CPM compatability file create. The user has formatted an
 16602                                  ;	FCB for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16603                                  ;
 16604                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB

 16621                                  ;============================================================================
 16622                                  ; SEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 16623                                  ;============================================================================
 16624                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16625                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16626                                  
 16627                                  ; DOSCODE:5DDFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 16628                                  
 16629                                  ; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 16630                                  ; DOSCODE:5DCBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 16631                                  
 16632                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16633                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16634                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16635                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16636                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16637                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16638                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16639                                  ;
 16640                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16641                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16642                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16643                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16644                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16645                                  ;
 16646                                  ;	Modification history:
 16647                                  ;
 16648                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16649                                  
 16650                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16651                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16652                                  ;
 16653                                  ; Inputs:
 16654                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16655                                  ; Function:
 16656                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16657                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16658                                  ; Returns:
 16659                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16660                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16661                                  
 16662                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16663                                  	
 16664                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16665                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16666                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16667                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16668                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16669                                  
 16670                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16671 00002528 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16672 0000252D 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16673 00002532 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16674 00002534 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16675 00002537 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16676 00002539 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16677                                  NORMFCB4:
 16678 0000253C FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16679                                  
 16680 0000253E 16                      	push	ss
 16681 0000253F 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16682                                  
 16683 00002540 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16684 00002543 E8CD56                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16685 00002546 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16686 00002548 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16687                                  
 16688                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16689                                  
 16690                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16691                                  dcf_errj:
 16692 00002549 E941E1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16693                                  
 16694                                  SearchIt:
 16695 0000254C 16                      	push	ss
 16696 0000254D 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16697                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16698                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16699                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16700 0000254E C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16701 00002552 57                      	push	di
 16702 00002553 06                      	push	es
 16703 00002554 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16704 0000255A 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16705                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16706                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16707                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16708 0000255E E8B90F                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16709 00002561 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16710 00002565 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16711 00002569 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16712 0000256B 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16713                                  
 16714                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16715                                  
 16716                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16717                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16718 0000256C EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16719                                  
 16720                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16721                                  ;
 16722                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16723                                  ;
 16724                                  ; Inputs:
 16725                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16726                                  ; Function:
 16727                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16728                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16729                                  ; Returns:
 16730                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16731                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16732                                  
 16733                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16734                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16735                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16736                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16737                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16738                                  
 16739                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16740 0000256E 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16741 00002573 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16742                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16743                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16744                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16745 00002578 B000                    	mov	al,0
 16746 0000257A 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16747 0000257E 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16748                                  
 16749 00002582 16                      	push	ss
 16750 00002583 07                      	pop	es
 16751                                  
 16752 00002584 BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16753                                  
 16754 00002587 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX

 16993                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16994                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16995                                  ;
 16996                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16997                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16998                                  ;
 16999                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:SI) = 11 character FCB or dir entry name
 17000                                  ;		(ES:DI) = destination area (13 bytes)
 17001                                  ;	EXIT	(ds:SI) and (es:DI) advanced
 17002                                  ;	USES	al, CX, SI, DI, Flags  (BUGBUG - not verified - jgl)
 17003                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17004                                  
 17005                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17006                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6627h
 17007                                  
 17008                                  PackName:
 17009                                  ;	Move over 8 characters to cover the name component, then trim it's
 17010                                  ;	trailing blanks.
 17011                                  
 17012                                  	;MOV	CX,8			; Pack the name
 17013                                  	;REP	MOVSB			; Move all of it
 17014                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17015 000026A8 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 17016 000026AB F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 17017                                  main_kill_tail:
 17018 000026AD 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 17019 000026B2 7507                    	JNZ	short find_check_dot
 17020 000026B4 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 17021 000026B5 41                      	INC	CX
 17022 000026B6 83F908                  	CMP	CX,8
 17023 000026B9 72F2                    	JB	short main_kill_tail
 17024                                  find_check_dot:
 17025                                  	;CMP	WORD [SI],(" " << 8) | " "
 17026 000026BB 813C2020                	cmp     word [si],2020h 
 17027 000026BF 7506                    	JNZ	short got_ext 		; Some chars in extension
 17028 000026C1 807C0220                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2]," "
 17029 000026C5 740F                    	JZ	short find_done		; No extension
 17030                                  got_ext:
 17031 000026C7 B02E                    	MOV	AL,"."	; 2Eh
 17032 000026C9 AA                      	STOSB
 17033                                  	;MOV	CX,3
 17034                                  	;; 18/12/2022
 17035                                  	;;mov	cl,3
 17036                                  	;;REP	MOVSB
 17037                                  	;movsb
 17038                                  	;movsb
 17039                                  	;movsb
 17040                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17041 000026CA A5                      	movsw
 17042 000026CB A4                      	movsb
 17043                                  ext_kill_tail:
 17044 000026CC 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 17045 000026D1 7503                    	JNZ	short find_done
 17046 000026D3 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 17047 000026D4 EBF6                    	JMP	short ext_kill_tail
 17048                                  find_done:
 17049 000026D6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 17050 000026D8 AA                      	STOSB				; NUL terminate
 17051 000026D9 C3                      	retn

 17077                                  ; DOSCODE:5FB0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17078                                  
 17079                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 17080                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 17081                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 17082                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 17083                                  ;
 17084                                  ;	$CURRENT_DIR  Written
 17085                                  ;	$RMDIR	  Written
 17086                                  ;	$CHDIR	  Written
 17087                                  ;	$MKDIR	  Written
 17088                                  ;
 17089                                  ;
 17090                                  ;	Modification history:
 17091                                  ;
 17092                                  ;	    Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17093                                  ;		 MZ 10 May 1983     CurrentDir implemented
 17094                                  ;		 MZ 11 May 1983     RmDir, ChDir, MkDir implemented
 17095                                  ;		 EE 19 Oct 1983     RmDir no longer allows you to delete a
 17096                                  ;				    current directory.
 17097                                  ;		 MZ 19 Jan 1983     Brain damaged applications rely on success
 17098                                  
 17099                                  ;	I_Need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to Current CDS
 17100                                  ;	I_Need	WFP_Start,WORD		; pointer to beginning of directory text
 17101                                  ;	I_Need	Curr_Dir_End,WORD	; offset to end of directory part
 17102                                  ;	I_Need	OpenBuf,128		; temp spot for translated name
 17103                                  ;	I_need	fSplice,BYTE		; TRUE => do splice
 17104                                  ;	I_Need	NoSetDir,BYTE		; TRUE => no exact match on splice
 17105                                  ;	I_Need	cMeta,BYTE
 17106                                  ;	I_Need	DrvErr,BYTE					;AN000;
 17107                                  
 17108                                  ;BREAK <$CURRENT_DIR - dump the current directory into user space>
 17109                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17110                                  ;
 17111                                  ;   Procedure Name : $CURRENT_DIR
 17112                                  ;
 17113                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17114                                  ;		LDS	SI,area
 17115                                  ;		MOV	DL,drive
 17116                                  ;		INT	21h
 17117                                  ;	    ; DS:SI is a pointer to 64 byte area that contains drive
 17118                                  ;	    ; current directory.
 17119                                  ;   Error returns:
 17120                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_drive
 17121                                  ;
 17122                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17123                                  
 17124                                  	; 06/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17125                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 2D4Eh
 17126                                  
 17127                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17128                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5F9Ch  ; Retro DOS v4.1 (& v4.0)
 17129                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5FB0h ; Retro DOS v4.2
 17130                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6393h
 17131                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6664h ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17132                                  
 17133                                  _$CURRENT_DIR:
 17134 000026DA E805F2                  	call	ECritDisk

 17136 000026DF E8A654                  	call	GetVisDrv		; grab it

 17138                                  CurdirErr:

 17162 000026FB C606[4C03]00            	mov	byte [NoSetDir],0 ; *
 17163                                  	
 17164                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17165                                  	;lds     si,[THISCDS]
 17166                                  
 17167                                  ; 16/12/2022
 17168                                  %if 0

 17259                                  ;	Delete directory if empty

 17267                                  ;		Directory malformed (. and .. not first two entries)

 17354                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17355                                  
 17356                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17357                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17358                                  ;
 17359                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17360                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17361                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17362                                  ;
 17363                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17364                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17365                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17366                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17367                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17368                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17369                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17370                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17371                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17372                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17373                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17374                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17375                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17376                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17377                                  ;
 17378                                  ; Inputs:
 17379                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17380                                  ; Returns:
 17381                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17382                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17383                                  ;
 17384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17385                                  	
 17386                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17387                                  	
 17388                                  _$CHDIR:
 17389                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17390                                  	;;;
 17391 0000278D 36C606[5411]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17392                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17393                                  	;;;
 17394 00002793 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17395 00002796 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17396 00002798 E8DA54                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17397 0000279B 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17398                                  ChDirErrP:
 17399                                  	;mov	al,3
 17400 0000279D B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17401                                  ChDirErr:
 17402                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!

 17425                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 17426                                  ;

 17438

 17442

 17453

 17459 000027DC 5E                      	pop	si
