 32156                                  
 32157                                  make_new:
 32158 00005501 E8F1FF                  	call	make_save
 32159 00005504 72FA                    	jc	short make_save_retn	; case 2 fail
 32160                                  	;test	byte [ATTRIB],10h
 32161 00005506 F606[6B05]10            	test	BYTE [ATTRIB],attr_directory
 32162 0000550B 75F3                    	jnz	short make_save_retn	; Don't "open" directories,
 32163                                  					; so don't tell the sharer about them
 32164 0000550D 50                      	push	ax
 32165 0000550E 53                      	push	bx
 32166 0000550F 56                      	push	si
 32167 00005510 E8912F                  	call	ShareEnter
 32168 00005513 5E                      	pop	si
 32169 00005514 5B                      	pop	bx
 32170 00005515 58                      	pop	ax
 32171 00005516 73E8                    	jnc	short make_save_retn
 32172                                  
 32173                                  ; We get here by having the user FAIL a share problem. Typically a failure of
 32174                                  ; this nature is an out-of-space or an internal error. We clean up as best as
 32175                                  ; possible: delete the newly created directory entry and return share_error.
 32176                                  
 32177 00005518 50                      	PUSH	AX
 32178 00005519 C43E[E205]              	LES	DI,[CURBUF]
 32179                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx],0E5h
 32180 0000551D 26C607E5                	MOV	BYTE [ES:BX],DIRFREE	; nuke newly created entry.
 32181                                  
 32182                                  ; 23/02/2024
 32183                                  %if 0	
 32184                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32185                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],40h
 32186                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 32187                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 32188                                  	JNZ	short yesdirty8		;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 32189                                  	; 22/11/2022
 32190                                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 32191                                  	;or	byte [es:di+5],40h
 32192                                  	OR	byte [ES:DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ; flag buffer as dirty
 32193                                  yesdirty8:
 32194                                  %else
 32195                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32196 00005521 E8AE16                  	call    SET_BUF_DIRTY
 32197                                  %endif
 32198 00005524 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 32199                                  	; 15/12/2022
 32200 00005528 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 32201                                  	; 22/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 32202                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 32203                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive for flush
 32204 0000552C E87D15                  	call	FLUSHBUF		; write out buffer.
 32205 0000552F 58                      	POP	AX
 32206 00005530 EBB6                    	jmp	short Make_Share_ret
 32207                                  
 32208                                  ; We have found an existing file. We have also entered it into the share set.
 32209                                  ; At this point we need to call newentry to correctly address the problem of
 32210                                  ; getting rid of old data (create an existing file) or creating a new
 32211                                  ; directory entry (create a new file). Unfortunately, this operation may
 32212                                  ; result in an INT 24 that the user doesn't return from, thus locking the file
 32213                                  ; irretrievably into the share set. The correct solution is for us to LEAVE
 32214                                  ; the share set now, do the operation and then reassert the share access.
 32215                                  ;
 32216                                  ; We are allowed to do this! There is no window! After all, we are in
 32217                                  ; critDisk here and for someone else to get in, they must enter critDisk also.
 32218                                  
 32219                                  	; 22/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32220                                  	; DOSCODE:89C8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32221                                  
 32222                                  MakeEndShare:
 32223 00005532 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]		; grab SFT
 32224 00005536 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 32225 00005538 E8A7C3                  	call	ECritSFT
 32226 0000553B 268705                  	xchg	AX,[ES:DI]
 32227                                  	;XCHG	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 32228 0000553E 50                      	push	ax
 32229 0000553F 57                      	push	di
 32230 00005540 06                      	push	es
 32231 00005541 9C                      	PUSHF
 32232 00005542 E85A2F                  	call	ShareEnd		; remove sharing
 32233 00005545 9D                      	POPF
 32234 00005546 07                      	pop	es
 32235 00005547 5F                      	pop	di
 32236 00005548 268F05                  	pop	word [ES:DI]
 32237                                  	;pop	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 32238 0000554B E8C1C3                  	call	LCritSFT
 32239                                  	; 22/11/2022
 32240                                  	; DOSCODE:89E4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32241 0000554E 5B                      	pop	bx
 32242 0000554F 5E                      	pop	si
 32243 00005550 59                      	pop	cx
 32244 00005551 58                      	pop	ax

 32246                                  
 32247                                  ; If the user failed, we do not reenter into the sharing set.
 32248

 32251 00005558 53                      	push	bx
 32252 00005559 56                      	push	si

 32254 0000555B E8462F                  	call	ShareEnter

 32258 00005561 58                      	pop	ax

 32260                                  ; If Share_check fails, then we have an internal ERROR!!!!!
 32261                                  
 32262                                  makeendshare_retn:
 32263 00005562 C3                      	retn
 32264                                  
 32265                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32266                                  ;
 32267                                  ; Procedure Name : NEWENTRY
 32268                                  ;
 32269                                  ; Inputs:
 32270                                  ;	  [THISSFT] set
 32271                                  ;	  [THISDPB] set
 32272                                  ;	  [LASTENT] current last valid entry number in directory if no free
 32273                                  ;		  entries
 32274                                  ;	  [VOLID] set if a volume ID was found during search
 32275                                  ;	Attrib Contains attributes for new file
 32276                                  ;	  [DIRSTART] Points to first cluster of dir (0 means root)
 32277                                  ;	  CARRY FLAG INDICATES STATUS OF SEARCH FOR FILE
 32278                                  ;		  NC means file existed (device)
 32279                                  ;		  C  means file did not exist
 32280                                  ;	  AH = Device ID byte
 32281                                  ;	  If FILE
 32282                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to start of directory entry
 32283                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to dir_first of directory entry
 32284                                  ;	  If device
 32285                                  ;	  DS:BX points to start of "fake" directory entry
 32286                                  ;	  DS:SI points to dir_first of "fake" directory entry
 32287                                  ;		  (has DWORD pointer to device header)
 32288                                  ; Function:
 32289                                  ;	  Make a new directory entry
 32290                                  ;	  If an old one existed it is truncated first
 32291                                  ; Outputs:
 32292                                  ;	  Carry set if error
 32293                                  ;		  Can't grow dir, atts didn't match, attempt to make 2nd
 32294                                  ;		  vol ID, user FAILed to I 24
 32295                                  ;	  else
 32296                                  ;		  outputs of DOOPEN
 32297                                  ; DS, BX, SI preserved (meaning on SI BX, not value), others destroyed
 32298                                  ;
 32299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32300                                  
 32301                                  	; 22/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32302                                  	; DOSCODE:89F9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32303                                  
 32304                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32305                                  	; DOSCODE:961Ah (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 32306                                  
 32307                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8A34h)
 32308                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8B7Dh)
 32309                                  
 32310                                  NEWENTRY:

 32326                                  newentry_retn:

 32333                                  
 32334                                  NOT_DEV1:

 32337                                  FREESPOT:

 32340 0000558F 7407                    	JZ	short NOTVOLID

 32342 00005596 75E4                    	JNZ	short ERRRET3	; Can't create a second volume ID
 32343                                  NOTVOLID:

 32345 0000559C 89DF                    	MOV	DI,BX
 32346

 32348

 32354

 32357                                  ;; File Tagging for Create DOS 4.00
 32358

 32380

 32383                                  				;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;

 32451                                  
 32452                                  ; DOOPEN
 32453                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32454                                  ;
 32455                                  ; Inputs:
 32456                                  ;	  [THISDPB] points to DPB if file
 32457                                  ;	  [THISSFT] points to SFT being used
 32458                                  ;	  AH = Device ID byte
 32459                                  ;	  If FILE
 32460                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to start of directory entry
 32461                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to dir_first of directory entry
 32462                                  ;	  If device
 32463                                  ;	  DS:BX points to start of "fake" directory entry
 32464                                  ;	  DS:SI points to dir_first of "fake" directory entry
 32465                                  ;		  (has DWORD pointer to device header)
 32466                                  ; Function:
 32467                                  ;	  Fill in SFT from dir entry
 32468                                  ; Outputs:
 32469                                  ;	  CARRY CLEAR
 32470                                  ;	  sf_ref_count and sf_mode fields not altered
 32471                                  ;	  sf_flags high byte = 0
 32472                                  ;	  sf_flags low byte = AH except
 32473                                  ;	  sf_flags Bit 6 set (not dirty or not EOF)
 32474                                  ;	  sf_attr sf_date sf_time sf_name set from entry
 32475                                  ;	  sf_position = 0
 32476                                  ;	  If device
 32477                                  ;	  sf_devptr = dword at dir_first (pointer to device header)
 32478                                  ;	  sf_size = 0
 32479                                  ;	  If file
 32480                                  ;	  sf_firclus sf_size set from entry
 32481                                  ;	  sf_devptr = [THISDPB]
 32482                                  ;	  sf_cluspos = 0
 32483                                  ;	  sf_lstclus = sf_firclus
 32484                                  ;	  sf_dirsec sf_dirpos set
 32485                                  ; DS,SI,BX preserved, others destroyed
 32486                                  ;
 32487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32488                                  
 32489                                  	; 23/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 32490                                  	; DOSCODE:96C3h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 32491                                  
 32492                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8AE4h)
 32493                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8C4Ch)
 32494

 32497                                  ;	Generate and store attribute
 32498

 32749                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32750                                  ;
 32751                                  ; Procedure Name : FREEENT
 32752                                  ;
 32753                                  ; Inputs:
 32754                                  ;	  ES:BP -> DPB
 32755                                  ;	  [CURBUF] Set
 32756                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:BX points to directory entry
 32757                                  ;	  [CURBUF+2]:SI points to above dir_first
 32758                                  ; Function:
 32759                                  ;	  Free the cluster chain for the entry if present
 32760                                  ; Outputs:
 32761                                  ;	  Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 32762                                  ;	  (NOTE dir_firclus and dir_size_l/h are wrong)
 32763                                  ; DS BX SI ES BP preserved (BX,SI in meaning, not value) others destroyed
 32764                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32765                                  
 32766                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32767                                  	; 24/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 32860                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32861                                  ;
 32862                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 32863                                  ;
 32864                                  ; CHECK_VIRT_OPEN checks to see if we had performed a "virtual open" (by
 32865                                  ; examining the flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN] to see if it is 1). If we did, then
 32866                                  ; it calls Dev_Close_SFT to decrement the ref. count. It also resets the
 32867                                  ; flag [VIRTUAL_OPEN].
 32868                                  ; No registers affected (including flags).
 32869                                  ; On input, [THISSFT] points to current SFT.
 32870                                  ;
 32871                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32872                                  
 32873                                  CHECK_VIRT_OPEN:
 32874                                  	PUSH	AX
 32875                                  	lahf			; preserve flags
 32876                                  	CMP	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0
 32877                                  	JZ	short ALL_CLOSED
 32878                                  	mov	byte [VIRTUAL_OPEN],0 ; reset flag
 32879                                  	push	es
 32880                                  	push	di
 32881                                  	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 32882                                  	call	DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 32883                                  	pop	di
 32884                                  	pop	es
 32885                                  
 32886                                  ALL_CLOSED:
 32887                                  	sahf			; restore flags
 32888                                  	POP	AX
 32889                                  	retn
 32890                                  
 32891                                  %endif

 32929                                  ;

 33145                                  ;Break  <BUFSEC -- BUFFER A SECTOR AND SET UP A TRANSFER>
 33146                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33147                                  ;
 33148                                  ; Procedure Name : BUFSEC
 33149                                  ;
 33150                                  ; Inputs:
 33151                                  ;       AH = priority of buffer
 33152                                  ;       AL = 0 if buffer must be read, 1 if no pre-read needed
 33153                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33154                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Physical cluster number
 33155                                  ;       [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector position of transfer within cluster
 33156                                  ;       [BYTCNT1] = Size of transfer
 33157                                  ; Function:
 33158                                  ;       Insure specified sector is in buffer, flushing buffer before
 33159                                  ;       read if necessary.
 33160                                  ; Outputs:
 33161                                  ;       ES:DI = Pointer to buffer
 33162                                  ;       SI = Pointer to transfer address
 33163                                  ;       CX = Number of bytes
 33164                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 33165                                  ;       [TRANS] set to indicate a transfer will occur
 33166                                  ;       Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 33167                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33168                                  
 33169                                  	; 25/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33170                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:98C2h
 33171                                  
 33172                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8BF1h) - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 33173                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8C2Ch) - Retro DOS v4.2
 33174                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0BE33h)
 33175                                  
 33176                                  BUFSEC:
 33177                                  	; 25/02/2024
 33178                                  	;;;
 33179                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33180 000057EC 8B16[DE0A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 33181                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx
 33182 000057F0 8716[E80A]              	xchg	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33183 000057F4 52                      	push	dx	; [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33184                                  	;;;
 33185 000057F5 8B16[BC05]                      MOV     DX,[CLUSNUM]
 33186 000057F9 8A1E[7305]                      MOV     BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 33187                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],38h
 33188 000057FD C606[4B03]38                    MOV     byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_IGNORE
 33189 00005802 E89A01                          CALL    FIGREC
 33190 00005805 E83F11                  	call	GETBUFFR
 33191                                  	; 25/02/2024
 33192                                  	;;;
 33193 00005808 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33194                                  	;;;
 33195 0000580C 72DD                            jc	short fndclus_retn
 33196                                  
 33197 0000580E C606[7405]01                    MOV     BYTE [TRANS],1	; A transfer is taking place
 33198 00005813 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 33199 00005817 89F7                            MOV     DI,SI
 33200 00005819 8B0E[D205]                      MOV     CX,[BYTCNT1]
 33201 0000581D 01CF                            ADD     DI,CX

 33490                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>

 33493                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 33494                                  ;
 33495                                  ; Inputs:
 33496                                  ;	  BX = Physical cluster
 33497                                  ;	  CX = No. of records

 33499                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33500                                  ;	  [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 33501                                  ; Outputs:
 33502                                  ;	  AX = No. of records remaining
 33503                                  ;	  BX = Transfer address

 33647                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 33648                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33649                                  ;
 33650                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 33651                                  ;
 33652                                  ; Inputs:

 33654                                  ;	  BL = Sector position within cluster
 33655                                  ;	  ES:BP = Base of drive parameters

 33658                                  ;	  [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)

 33661                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33662                                  
 33663                                  	; 10/06/2019
 33664                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33665                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33666                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33667                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33668                                  
 33669                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 33677                                  	;;;

 33689 000059B0 E307                    	jcxz	noshift

 33762                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33763                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 33764                                  
 33765                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 33766                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset
 33767                                  
 33768                                  ; Burada Kaldým... 28/06/2024 
 33769                                  
 33770                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 33771                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33772                                  ;
 33773                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 33774                                  ;
 33775                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 33776                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 33777                                  ;
 33778                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 33779                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 33780                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 33781                                  ;
 33782                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 33783                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 33784                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 33785                                  ;
 33786                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 33787                                  ;
 33788                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 33789                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 33790                                  ;           ELSE
 33791                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 33792                                  ;
 33793                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 33794                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 33795                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 33796                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 33797                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 33798                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 33799                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 33800                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 33801                                  ;   allocated.
 33802                                  ;
 33803                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 33804                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 33805                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 33806                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 33807                                  ;
 33808                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33809                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33810                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33811                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 33812                                  ;   explanation:
 33813                                  ;
 33814                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 33815                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 33816                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 33817                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 33818                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 33819                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 33820                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 33821                                  ;   the
 33822                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 33823                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 33824                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 33825                                  ;
 33826                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 33827                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 33828                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 33829                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 33830                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 33831                                  ;
 33832                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 33833                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 33834                                  ;                                                                          ;
 33835                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 33836                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 33837                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 33838                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 33839                                  ;
 33840                                  ;       EXIT   'C' set if insufficient space
 33841                                  ;                [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 33842                                  ;                CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 33843                                  ;              'C' clear if space allocated
 33844                                  ;                BX = First cluster allocated
 33845                                  ;                FAT is fully updated
 33846                                  ;                sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 33847                                  ;
 33848                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 33849                                  
 33850                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 33851                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 33852                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 33853                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 33854                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 33855                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 33856                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 33857                                  ;callmagic  endp
 33858                                  
 33859                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33860                                  ;PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9AC5h
 33861                                  
 33862                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC2h)
 33863                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C078h)
 33864                                  
 33865                                  ; 25/09/2023
 33866                                  %if 1	; 27/02/2024
 33867                                  callmagic:
 33868 000059D7 1E                      	push	ds
 33869 000059D8 36FF36[0906]            	push	word [ss:OffsetMagicPatch]
 33870 000059DD CB                      	retf	
 33871                                  %endif
 33872                                  
 33873                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33874                                  %if 1
 33875                                  ALLOCATE_X:
 33876 000059DE A3[F00A]                	mov	[CCOUNT_HW],ax
 33877                                  	;jmp	short ALLOCATE
 33878                                  %endif
 33879                                  
 33880                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33881                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9ACFh
 33882                                  
 33883                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8DC9h)
 33884                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C07Fh)

 33889                                  ;

 33891                                  ;

 33893                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 33894                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 33895                                  ;data would not.
 33896                                  ;        
 33897                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 33898                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 33899                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 33900                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 33901                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata

 33905                                  	;				;if no patch is present

 33907                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 33908                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 33909                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 33910                                  
 33911                                  ; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 33913

 33926                                  
 33927                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 33928                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 33929                                  
 33930                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33931                                  	; DOSCODE:9AD6h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 33932                                  
 33933 000059EB 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 33934 000059EC 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 33935                                  
 33936                                  	; 27/02/2024
 33937                                  	;;;
 33938 000059EE FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33939 000059F2 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; cluster 0
 33940                                  	;;;
 33941                                  
 33942 000059F6 E8FE08                  	call	UNPACK
 33943 000059F9 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 33944                                  
 33945                                  	; 27/02/2024
 33946                                  	;;;		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = content of FAT (for cluster 0)
 33947 000059FD 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 33948 00005A01 891E[E40A]              	mov	[FATBYT_HW],bx
 33949 00005A05 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33950                                  	;;;
 33951                                  
 33952 00005A09 5B                              POP     BX
 33953 00005A0A 72CA                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error [INTERR?]
 33954                                  
 33955                                  ; 27/02/2024
 33956                                  %if 0
 33957                                          PUSH    CX
 33958                                          PUSH    BX
 33959                                  
 33960                                          MOV     DX,BX
 33961                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 33962                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 33963                                          mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 33964                                          cmp     bx,2
 33965                                          ja	short FINDFRE
 33966                                  
 33967                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 33968                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 33969                                  
 33970                                  ads1:
 33971                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 33972                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 33973                                          mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 33974                                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 33975                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 33976                                  %else
 33977                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 33978                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 33979                                  	;;;
 33980 00005A0C FF36[F00A]              	push	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 33981 00005A10 51                      	push	cx
 33982 00005A11 FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33983 00005A15 53                      	push	bx
 33984                                  
 33985 00005A16 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 33986                                  
 33987 00005A18 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 33988                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx ; 0
 33989 00005A1A 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 33990 00005A1E 871E[E80A]              	xchg	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 33991 00005A22 891E[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],bx
 33992                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]
 33993 00005A26 268B5E1D                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 33994 00005A2A 7510                    	jnz	short ads1		; not FAT32
 33995                                  
 33996                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+3Bh]
 33997 00005A2C 268B5E3B                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 33998 00005A30 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 33999                                  	;cmp	bx,0
 34000 00005A34 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 34001                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+39h]
 34002 00005A36 268B5E39                	mov	bx,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 34003 00005A3A 7526                    	jnz	short FINDFRE
 34004                                  ads1:
 34005 00005A3C 83FB02                  	cmp	bx,2
 34006 00005A3F 7721                    	ja	short FINDFRE
 34007                                  ads2:
 34008 00005A41 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 34009                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx
 34010 00005A43 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 34011 00005A47 750A                    	jnz	short ads3		; not FAT32
 34012                                  
 34013                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+39h],2
 34014 00005A49 26C746390200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE],2
 34015                                  	;mov	[es:bp+3Bh],bx
 34016 00005A4F 26895E3B                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2],bx ; 0
 34017                                  ads3:
 34018 00005A53 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 34019                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2	
 34020 00005A57 26C7461D0200            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 34021 00005A5D 43                      	inc	bx ; 1
 34022                                  	;or	[es:bp+18h],bl
 34023 00005A5E 26085E18                	or	[es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],bl ; 1	
 34024                                  	;;;
 34025                                  %endif
 34026                                  
 34027                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 34028                                  ;
 34029                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 34030                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 34031                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 34032                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 34033                                  
 34034                                  FINDFRE:
 34035                                  %if 0
 34036                                          INC     BX
 34037                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 34038                                          CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 34039                                  	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 34040                                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 34041                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 34042                                          jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 34043                                  
 34044                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 34045                                  ;
 34046                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 34047                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 34048                                  
 34049                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 34050                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 34051                                          mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 34052                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 34053                                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 34054                                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 34055                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 34056                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 34057                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34058                                  	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 34059                                          JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 34060                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 34061                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 34062                                          DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 34063                                  NO_ALLOC:
 34064                                          xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 34065                                          XCHG    BX,DX
 34066                                          MOV     AX,DX
 34067                                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 34068                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 34069                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 34070                                          jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 34071                                          xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 34072                                          mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 34073                                          LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 34074                                  %else
 34075                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34076                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34077                                  	;;;
 34078                                  	;add	bx,1
 34079                                  	;adc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 34080 00005A62 43                      	inc	bx
 34081 00005A63 7504                    	jnz	short FINDFRE2
 34082 00005A65 FF06[E80A]              	inc	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34083                                  FINDFRE2:
 34084                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 34085 00005A69 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 34086 00005A6E 7512                    	jnz	short ads4 ; not FAT32
 34087                                  	; FAT32
 34088 00005A70 53                      	push	bx
 34089 00005A71 8B1E[E80A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34090                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Fh]
 34091 00005A75 263B5E2F                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 34092 00005A79 5B                      	pop	bx
 34093 00005A7A 750A                    	jne	short ads5
 34094                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 34095 00005A7C 263B5E2D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 34096 00005A80 EB04                    	jmp	short ads5
 34097                                  ads4:
 34098                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 34099 00005A82 263B5E0D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 34100                                  ads5:
 34101 00005A86 7603                    	jbe	short ads6 ; jna short ads6
 34102 00005A88 E9ED00                  	jmp	ads15
 34103                                  ads6:
 34104                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34105                                  	;push	cx
 34106                                  	;push	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 34107                                  	;push	bx
 34108                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34109                                  	;push	dx
 34110                                  	;push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34111                                  
 34112 00005A8B E86908                  	call	UNPACK
 34113                                  
 34114                                  	; 27/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34115                                  	;pop	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 34116                                  	;pop	dx
 34117                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34118                                  	;pop	bx
 34119                                  	;pop	word [CCOUNT_HW]
 34120                                  	;pop	cx
 34121

 34123                                  	
 34124 00005A90 E9A200                  	jmp	ads13
 34125                                  ads7:
 34126 00005A93 75CD                    	jnz	short FINDFRE
 34127                                  
 34128                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx
 34129 00005A95 26895E1D                	mov	[es:bp+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx
 34130                                  
 34131                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 34132 00005A99 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 34133 00005A9E 750E                    	jnz	short ads8 ; not FAT32
 34134                                  	; FAT32
 34135 00005AA0 53                      	push	bx

 34480                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 34481                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34482                                  ;
 34483                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 34484                                  ;
 34485                                  ; Inputs:
 34486                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 34487                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 34488                                  ; Function:
 34489                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 34490                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34491                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 34492                                  ;
 34493                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34494                                  
 34495                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34496                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D13h
 34497                                  
 34498                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E86h)
 34499                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C27Fh)
 34500                                  
 34501                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34502                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34503                                  RELEASE:
 34504 00005BE4 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 34505                                  	
 34506                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34507                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34508                                  	;;;
 34509 00005BE6 8916[EA0A]              	mov	[CLUSDATA_HW],dx ; (dx = 0, release)
 34510                                  	;;;
 34511                                  
 34512                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D19h
 34513                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8E88h)
 34514                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C285h)
 34515                                  
 34516                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 34517                                  RELBLKS:
 34518                                  
 34519                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 34520                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 34521                                  
 34522 00005BEA E80A07                  	call	UNPACK
 34523                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34524                                  	;jz	short RELEASE_flush
 34525                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34526 00005BED 7652                            jbe	short RET12 ; jna short RET12
 34527                                  				; CCONTENT_HW:DI= Content of FAT
 34528                                   				; for given cluster (next cluster)
 34529 00005BEF 89F8                    	MOV     AX,DI
 34530 00005BF1 52                              PUSH    DX
 34531                                  
 34532                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34533                                  	;push	ax
 34534                                  	;;;
 34535                                  
 34536 00005BF2 E8B007                  	call	PACK
 34537                                  
 34538                                  	;;; 28/12/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34539                                  	;pop	ax
 34540 00005BF5 8B16[EC0A]              	mov	dx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34541 00005BF9 8916[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],dx ; next cluster (hw) to be released
 34542 00005BFD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax		 ; next cluster (lw) to be released
 34543                                  	;;;
 34544                                          
 34545 00005BFF 5A                      	POP     DX
 34546                                  	;jc	short RELEASE_flush
 34547                                  	; 28/12/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34548 00005C00 723F                    	jc	short RET12
 34549                                          
 34550 00005C02 09D2                    	OR      DX,DX
 34551 00005C04 751F                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 34552                                  
 34553                                  ; 28/02/2024
 34554                                  %if 0
 34555                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 34556                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 34557                                  	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 34558                                          JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 34559                                          INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34560                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34561                                          MOV     BX,AX
 34562                                          dec     ax              	; check for "1"
 34563                                  	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34564                                  %else
 34565                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34566                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34567                                  	;;;
 34568 00005C06 3B16[EA0A]              	cmp	dx,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; > 0 ? (delete, release)
 34569 00005C0A 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC	; no, EOF (allocate, -1), (dx = 0)
 34570                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh
 34571 00005C0C 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 34572                                  					; Free count valid?
 34573 00005C11 7412                    	jz	short NO_DEALLOC	; No (dx = 0)
 34574                                  relblks_ifc:
 34575                                  	;inc	word ptr es:[bp+1Fh]
 34576 00005C13 26FF461F                	inc	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 34577 00005C17 7519                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34578                                  
 34579                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34580 00005C19 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx
 34581 00005C1D 7513                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2	; not FAT32
 34582                                  
 34583                                  	;inc	word [es:bp+21h]
 34584 00005C1F 26FF4621                	inc	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 34585 00005C23 EB0D                    	jmp	short NO_DEALLOC2
 34586                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 34587                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 34588 00005C25 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx	; dx is -1 or 0
 34589                                  					; (valid 16 bit fat size is another number)
 34590 00005C29 7507                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC2 ; FAT (FAT16 or FAT12)
 34591                                  					; dx = 0, FAT32
 34592                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh
 34593 00005C2B 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2],0FFFFh
 34594 00005C30 75E1                    	jnz	short relblks_ifc
 34595                                  NO_DEALLOC2:
 34596 00005C32 833E[E80A]00            	cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 34597 00005C37 7503                    	jnz	short NO_DEALLOC3
 34598 00005C39 48                      	dec	ax			; check for "1"	
 34599 00005C3A 7405                    	jz	short RET12		; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 34600                                  NO_DEALLOC3:
 34601                                  	;;;
 34602                                  %endif
 34603                                  
 34604 00005C3C E88F06                  	call	IsEOF
 34605 00005C3F 72A3                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 34606                                  
 34607                                  	; 16/12/2022
 34608                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34609                                  ; 28/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34610                                  %if 0
 34611                                  RELEASE_flush:
 34612                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34613                                  	mov	al,[es:bp]
 34614                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 34615                                  	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 34616                                  	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 34617                                  	push	es
 34618                                  	push	bp
 34619                                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 34620                                  	pop	bp
 34621                                  	pop	es
 34622                                  	pop	cx
 34623                                  	pop	si
 34624                                  %endif		; 28/02/2024
 34625                                  
 34626                                  RET12:
 34627 00005C41 C3                      	retn
 34628                                  
 34629                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 34630                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34631                                  ;
 34632                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 34633                                  ;
 34634                                  ; Inputs:
 34635                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 34636                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 34637                                  ;       DS = CS
 34638                                  ; Outputs:
 34639                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 34640                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 34641                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 34642                                  ;
 34643                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34644                                  
 34645                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34646                                  %if 0
 34647                                  GETEOF:
 34648                                  	call	UNPACK
 34649                                          jc	short RET12
 34650                                          PUSH    BX
 34651                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34652                                  	call	IsEOF
 34653                                          POP     BX
 34654                                          JAE     short RET12
 34655                                          MOV     BX,DI
 34656                                          JMP     short GETEOF
 34657                                  %else
 34658                                  	; 28/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34659                                  	;;;
 34660                                  GETEOF4:	; **
 34661 00005C42 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34662                                  GETEOF1:
 34663 00005C46 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 34664 00005C48 8916[F20A]              	mov	[CLUSTERS_HW],dx ; CLUSTERS_HW:DI = Cluster Count
 34665 00005C4C 58                      	pop	ax
 34666 00005C4D 5A                      	pop	dx
 34667 00005C4E C3                      	retn
 34668                                  
 34669                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9D7Ch
 34670                                  GETEOF:
 34671 00005C4F 52                      	push	dx
 34672 00005C50 50                      	push	ax
 34673 00005C51 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0	; cluster count = 0
 34674 00005C53 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 34675                                  GETEOF2:
 34676 00005C55 E89F06                  	call	UNPACK
 34677 00005C58 72EC                    	jc	short GETEOF1
 34678                                  		; CCONTENT_HW:DI = next cluster (cluster content)
 34679 00005C5A 40                      	inc	ax
 34680 00005C5B 7501                    	jnz	short GETEOF3
 34681 00005C5D 42                      	inc	dx
 34682                                  GETEOF3:
 34683 00005C5E FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34684 00005C62 53                      	push    bx
 34685                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 34686 00005C63 8B1E[EC0A]              	mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW]
 34687 00005C67 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34688 00005C6B 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34689 00005C6D E85E06                  	call	IsEOF
 34690                                  	;pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW] ; * ; 28/02/2024
 34691 00005C70 5B                      	pop	bx
 34692                                  	;jae	short GETEOF1   ; EOF
 34693 00005C71 73CF                    	jae	short GETEOF4 ; ** ; 28/02/2024
 34694                                  	;mov	bx,[CCONTENT_HW] ; not EOF
 34695                                  	;mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 34696 00005C73 5B                      	pop	bx	; * ; 28/02/2024
 34697 00005C74 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 34698 00005C76 EBDD                    	jmp	short GETEOF2   ; get next cluster
 34699                                  	;;;
 34700                                  %endif

 34709                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 34710                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 34711

 34720                                  ;	GetLet3

 34725                                  ;

 34727                                  ;
 34728                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988

 34730                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 34731                                  
 34732                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 34733                                  
 34734                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 34735                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 34736                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 34737                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
