 34739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34740                                  ;
 34741                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 34742                                  ;
 34743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34744                                  
 34745                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34746                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34747                                  
 34748                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34749                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9DB0h
 34750                                  
 34751                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:8ED3h)
 34752                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:8D92h)
 34753                                  
 34754                                  MAKEFCB:
 34755                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34756                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 34757 00005C78 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 34758                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34759 00005C7A 368816[4E03]            	mov	[ss:SpaceFlag],dl ; 0
 34760                                  	;test	al,2
 34761 00005C7F A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 34762 00005C81 7503                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 34763                                  	;MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 34764                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34765 00005C83 268815                  	mov	[es:di],dl ; 0
 34766                                  DEFDRV:
 34767 00005C86 47                      	INC	DI
 34768 00005C87 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34769                                  	;test	al,4
 34770 00005C8A A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 34771 00005C8C 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 34772 00005C8D B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34773 00005C8F 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 34774 00005C91 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34775 00005C93 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 34776                                  FILLB:
 34777 00005C95 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34778 00005C97 B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 34779 00005C99 F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 34780 00005C9C 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 34781 00005C9E 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34782 00005CA0 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 34783                                  FILLB2:
 34784 00005CA2 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34785 00005CA4 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 34786 00005CA5 AB                      	STOSW
 34787 00005CA6 AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 34788 00005CA7 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 34789                                  	;test	bl,1
 34790 00005CAA F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 34791 00005CAD 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 34792 00005CAF E88800                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 34793 00005CB2 E81E01                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 34794 00005CB5 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 34795 00005CB7 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 34796                                  SKPSPC:
 34797 00005CB8 E87F00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Always kill preceding blanks and tabs
 34798                                  NOSCAN:
 34799 00005CBB E8EC00                  	CALL	GETLET
 34800 00005CBE 761E                    	JBE	short NODRV	; Quit if termination character
 34801 00005CC0 803C3A                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],":"	; Check for potential drive specifier
 34802 00005CC3 7519                    	JNZ	short NODRV
 34803 00005CC5 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over colon
 34804 00005CC6 2C40                    	SUB	AL,"@"          ; Convert drive letter to drive number (A=1)
 34805 00005CC8 760F                    	JBE	short BADDRV	; Drive letter out of range
 34806                                  
 34807 00005CCA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 34808 00005CCB E8BA1E                  	call	GetVisDrv
 34809 00005CCE 58                      	POP	AX
 34810 00005CCF 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 34811                                  
 34812                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34813                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34814                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34815 00005CD1 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 34816                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 34817 00005CD7 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;
 34818                                  BADDRV:
 34819 00005CD9 B2FF                    	MOV	DL,-1
 34820                                  HAVDRV:
 34821 00005CDB AA                      	STOSB			; Put drive specifier in first byte
 34822 00005CDC 46                      	INC	SI
 34823 00005CDD 4F                      	DEC	DI		; Counteract next two instructions
 34824                                  NODRV:
 34825 00005CDE 4E                      	DEC	SI		; Back up
 34826 00005CDF 47                      	INC	DI		; Skip drive byte
 34827                                  
 34828                                  	;entry	NORMSCAN
 34829                                  NORMSCAN:
 34830 00005CE0 B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 34831 00005CE3 E82200                  	CALL	GETWORD 	; Get 8-letter file name
 34832 00005CE6 803C2E                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],"."
 34833 00005CE9 7510                    	JNZ	short NODOT
 34834 00005CEB 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over dot if present
 34835                                  
 34836                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34837                                  	;mov	cx,3
 34838 00005CEC B103                    	mov	cl,3	; ch=0
 34839                                  
 34840                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34841                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34842                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],DBCS_VOLID2 ; 100h ;AN000;
 34843                                  	; 10/06/2019
 34844 00005CEE 36F606[1206]01          	test	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(DBCS_VOLID2>>8) ; 1
 34845 00005CF4 7402                    	JZ	short VOLOK				;AN000;
 34846 00005CF6 A4                      	MOVSB			; 2nd byte of DBCS	;AN000;
 34847                                  	; 24/09/2023
 34848                                  	;MOV	CX,2					;AN000;
 34849 00005CF7 49                      	dec	cx  ; cx=2
 34850                                  	;JMP	SHORT contvol				;AN000;
 34851                                  VOLOK:
 34852                                  	;MOV	CX,3		; Get 3-letter extension
 34853                                  contvol:
 34854 00005CF8 E81300                  	CALL	MUSTGETWORD
 34855                                  NODOT:
 34856 00005CFB 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
 34857                                  
 34858                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 34859                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],0FEFFh
 34860                                  	; 18/12/2022
 34861 00005CFD 368026[1206]FE          	and	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],0FEh ; (~DBCS_VOLID2)>>8
 34862                                  	;and	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],~DBCS_VOLID2 ; ### BUG FIX ###
 34863                                  
 34864 00005D03 C3                      	retn
 34865                                  
 34866                                  NONAM:
 34867 00005D04 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 34868 00005D06 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34869 00005D07 C3                      	retn
 34870                                  
 34871                                  GETWORD:
 34872 00005D08 E89F00                  	CALL	GETLET		
 34873 00005D0B 76F7                    	JBE	short NONAM	; Exit if invalid character
 34874 00005D0D 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34875                                  
 34876                                  ;	UGH!!! Horrible bug here that should be fixed at some point:
 34877                                  ;	If the name we are scanning is longer than CX, we keep on reading!
 34878                                  
 34879                                  MUSTGETWORD:
 34880 00005D0E E89900                  	CALL	GETLET
 34881                                  
 34882                                  ;	If spaceFlag is set then we allow spaces in a pathname
 34883                                  
 34884                                  ;IF NOT TABLELOOK
 34885                                  ;	JB	short FILLNAM  ; MSDOS 3.3
 34886                                  ;ENDIF
 34887 00005D11 750C                    	JNZ	short MustCheckCX
 34888                                  
 34889                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34890 00005D13 36F606[4E03]FF          	test	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0FFh
 34891 00005D19 7419                    	JZ	short FILLNAM
 34892 00005D1B 3C20                    	CMP	AL," "
 34893 00005D1D 7515                    	JNZ	short FILLNAM
 34894                                  
 34895                                  MustCheckCX:
 34896 00005D1F E3ED                    	JCXZ	MUSTGETWORD
 34897 00005D21 49                      	DEC	CX
 34898 00005D22 3C2A                    	CMP	AL,"*"          ; Check for ambiguous file specifier
 34899 00005D24 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSTAR
 34900 00005D26 B03F                    	MOV	AL,"?"
 34901 00005D28 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34902                                  NOSTAR:
 34903 00005D2A AA                      	STOSB
 34904 00005D2B 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,"?"
 34905 00005D2D 75DF                    	JNZ	short MUSTGETWORD
 34906 00005D2F 80CA01                  	OR	DL,1		; Flag ambiguous file name
 34907 00005D32 EBDA                    	JMP	short MUSTGETWORD
 34908                                  FILLNAM:
 34909 00005D34 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 34910 00005D36 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 34911 00005D38 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34912 00005D39 C3                      	retn
 34913                                  
 34914                                  SCANB:
 34915 00005D3A AC                      	LODSB
 34916 00005D3B E89D00                  	CALL	SPCHK
 34917 00005D3E 74FA                    	JZ	short SCANB
 34918 00005D40 4E                      	DEC	SI
 34919                                  scanb_retn:
 34920 00005D41 C3                      	retn
 34921                                  
 34922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34923                                  ;
 34924                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 34925                                  ;
 34926                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 34927                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 34928                                  ;
 34929                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 34930                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 34931                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 34932                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 34933                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 34934                                  ;
 34935                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34936                                  
 34937                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34938                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34939                                  
 34940                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34941                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:9E7Ch
 34942                                  
 34943                                  NameTrans:
 34944                                  ;hkn; SS override
 34945 00005D42 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 34946 00005D48 16                      	push	ss
 34947 00005D49 07                      	pop	es
 34948                                  
 34949                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 34950 00005D4A BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 34951 00005D4D 57                      	PUSH	DI
 34952                                  
 34953                                  ; 29/02/2024
 34954                                  %if 0
 34955                                  	MOV	AX,'  '	; 2020h
 34956                                  	MOV	CX,5
 34957                                  	STOSB
 34958                                  	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34959                                  	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 34960                                  	MOV	DL,AL
 34961                                  %else
 34962                                  	; 29/02/2024
 34963                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 34964                                  	;;;
 34965 00005D4E B020                    	mov     al, 20h ; ' '
 34966 00005D50 B90B00                  	mov     cx, 11
 34967 00005D53 F3AA                    	rep stosb               ; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 34968 00005D55 91                      	xchg    ax, cx
 34969 00005D56 99                      	cwd
 34970                                  	;;;
 34971                                  %endif
 34972                                  
 34973 00005D57 AA                      	STOSB
 34974 00005D58 5F                      	POP	DI
 34975                                  
 34976 00005D59 E884FF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 34977                                  
 34978                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 34979 00005D5C 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 34980 00005D62 75DD                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 34981 00005D64 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 34982 00005D6A C3                      	retn
 34983                                  
 34984                                  ;Break	<GETLET, DELIM -- CHECK CHARACTERS AND CONVERT>
 34985                                  ;============================================================================
 34986                                  
 34987                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34988                                  ; DOSCODE:8FD2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34989                                  
 34990                                  ;If TableLook
 34991                                  
 34992                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 34993                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 34994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34995                                  
 34996                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 34997                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 34998                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 34999                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 35000                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 35001                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 35002                                  
 35003                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 35004                                  ;CharType:
 35005                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35006                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 35007                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35008                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 35009                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35010                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 35011                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35012                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 35013                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35014                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 35015                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35016                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 35017                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35018                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 35019                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35020                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 35021                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35022                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 35023                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35024                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 35025                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35026                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 35027                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35028                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 35029                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35030                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 35031                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35032                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35034                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 35035                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35036                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 35037                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 35038                                  ;	      ; # and "
 35039                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 35040                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 35041                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 35042                                  ;	      ; + and *
 35043                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 35044                                  ;	      ; - and '
 35045                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 35046                                  ;	      ; / and .
 35047                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35048                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 35049                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 35050                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 35051                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 35052                                  ;	      ; = and <
 35053                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 35054                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 35055                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 35056                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 35057                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 35058                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 35059                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 35060                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 35061                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 35062                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 35063                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 35064                                  ;	      ; } and |
 35065                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 35066                                  
 35067                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 35068                                  ;					; character in the table
 35069                                  
 35070                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed

 35133                                  
 35134                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35135                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35136                                  
 35137                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35138                                  ;
 35139                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 35140                                  ;
 35141                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 35142                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 35143                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 35144                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 35145                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 35146                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 35147                                  ;
 35148                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 35149                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 35150                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 35151                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 35152                                  ;
 35153                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 35154                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 35155                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 35156                                  ;
 35157                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35158                                  
 35159                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 35160                                  
 35161                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 35162                                  GETLET:	
 35163 00005DAA AC                      	LODSB
 35164                                  
 35165                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 35166                                  
 35167                                  	;entry	UCase
 35168                                  UCase:	
 35169                                  	; 09/08/2018
 35170                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 35171                                  _UCase:
 35172 00005DAB 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35173 00005DAC BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 35174                                  
 35175                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 35176                                  
 35177                                  gl_0:
 35178 00005DAF 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 35179 00005DB1 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 35180 00005DB3 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 35181 00005DB5 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 35182 00005DB7 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 35183                                  
 35184                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 35185                                  
 35186                                  gl_1:
 35187 00005DB9 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 35188 00005DBB 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 35189 00005DBD 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 35190                                  
 35191                                  	; M048 - Start 
 35192                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 35193                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 35194                                  	; preserve it.
 35195                                  
 35196                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35197                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35198                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35199                                  	;CS	XLAT
 35200                                  
 35201                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35202                                  
 35203                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35204 00005DBF 1E                      	push	ds
 35205                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 35206 00005DC0 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35207 00005DC5 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35208 00005DC6 1F                      	pop	ds
 35209                                  
 35210                                  	; M048 - End
 35211                                  
 35212                                  ; Now check the type
 35213                                  
 35214                                  ;If TableLook
 35215                                  gl_2:
 35216                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35217 00005DC7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35218                                  
 35219                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35220                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35221                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 35222                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35223                                  	;cs	xlat	
 35224                                  	
 35225                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35226 00005DC8 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 35227                                  	
 35228                                  	;test	al,1	
 35229 00005DCB A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 35230 00005DCD 58                      	POP	AX
 35231                                  
 35232 00005DCE 5B                      	POP	BX
 35233 00005DCF C3                      	RETN
 35234                                  
 35235                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 35236                                  
 35237                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35238                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 35239                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 35240 00005DD0 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35241 00005DD1 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 35242                                  ;ELSE
 35243                                  ;
 35244                                  ;gl_2:
 35245                                  ;	POP	BX
 35246                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 35247                                  ;	retz
 35248                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 35249                                  ;	retz
 35250                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 35251                                  ;	retz
 35252                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 35253                                  ;	retz
 35254                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 35255                                  ;	retz
 35256                                  ;ENDIF
 35257                                  
 35258                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35259                                  ;
 35260                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 35261                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 35262                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 35263                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 35264                                  ;
 35265                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 35266                                  
 35267                                  	;entry	DELIM
 35268                                  DELIM:
 35269                                  ;IF TableLook
 35270                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35271 00005DD3 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35272                                  
 35273                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35274                                  	;push	bx
 35275                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35276                                  	;;09/08/2018
 35277                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35278                                  	;cs	xlat
 35279                                  	;pop	bx
 35280                                  
 35281                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35282 00005DD4 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 35283                                  	
 35284                                  	;test	al,2
 35285 00005DD7 A802                    	TEST	AL,FDELIM
 35286 00005DD9 58                      	POP	AX
 35287 00005DDA C3                      	RETN
 35288                                  ;ELSE
 35289                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 35290                                  ;	retz
 35291                                  ;
 35292                                  ;	CMP	AL,"<"
 35293                                  ;	retz
 35294                                  ;	CMP	AL,"|"
 35295                                  ;	retz
 35296                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 35297                                  ;	retz
 35298                                  ;
 35299                                  ;	CMP	AL,"+"
 35300                                  ;	retz
 35301                                  ;	CMP	AL,"="
 35302                                  ;	retz
 35303                                  ;	CMP	AL,";"
 35304                                  ;	retz
 35305                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 35306                                  ;	retz
 35307                                  ;ENDIF
 35308                                  
 35309                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35310                                  ;
 35311                                  ;  SPCHK - checks to see if a character is a space or equivalent
 35312                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to check
 35313                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is a space
 35314                                  ;	Uses  : flags
 35315                                  ;
 35316                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35317                                  
 35318                                  	;entry SPCHK
 35319                                  SPCHK:
 35320                                  ;IF TableLook
 35321                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35322 00005DDB 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35323                                  
 35324                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35325                                  	;push	bx
 35326                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35327                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 35328                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35329                                  	;cs	xlat
 35330                                  	;pop	bx
 35331                                  
 35332                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35333 00005DDC E80400                  	CALL	GetCharType
 35334                                  	
 35335                                  	;test	al,4
 35336 00005DDF A804                    	TEST	AL,FSPCHK
 35337 00005DE1 58                      	POP	AX
 35338 00005DE2 C3                      	RETN
 35339                                  ;ELSE
 35340                                  ;	CMP	AL,9		; Filter out tabs too
 35341                                  ;	retz
 35342                                  ;; WARNING! " " MUST be the last compare
 35343                                  ;	CMP	AL," "
 35344                                  ;	return
 35345                                  ;ENDIF
 35346                                  
 35347                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35348                                  ;
 35349                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 35350                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 35351                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 35352                                  ;
 35353                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 35354                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 35355                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 35356                                  ;
 35357                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35358                                  
 35359                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35360                                  
 35361                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35362                                  
 35363                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35364                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35365                                  
 35366                                  GetCharType:
 35367                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 35368 00005DE3 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 35369 00005DE5 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 35370                                  
 35371 00005DE7 53                      	push	bx
 35372 00005DE8 BB[6B5D]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 35373 00005DEB D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 35374                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 35375 00005DED 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 35376 00005DEF 5B                      	pop	bx
 35377                                  
 35378                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 35379                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 35380                                  
 35381 00005DF0 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 35382                                  
 35383                                  ; 29/02/2024
 35384                                  %if 0
 35385                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35386                                  	shr	al,1
 35387                                  	shr	al,1
 35388                                  	shr	al,1
 35389                                  %else
 35390                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35391                                  	;;;
 35392 00005DF2 51                      	push	cx
 35393 00005DF3 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35394 00005DF5 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 35395 00005DF7 59                      	pop	cx
 35396                                  	;;;
 35397                                  %endif
 35398                                  
 35399                                  gct_80:
 35400 00005DF8 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 35401 00005DFA C3                      	retn
 35402                                  gct_90:
 35403 00005DFB B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 35404 00005DFD C3                      	retn
 35405

 35412                                  PATHCHRCMP:
 35413 00005DFE 3C2F                    	CMP	AL,'/'
 35414 00005E00 7606                    	JBE	short PathRet
 35415 00005E02 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 35416 00005E04 C3                      	retn
 35417                                  GotFor:
 35418 00005E05 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 35419 00005E07 C3                      	retn
 35420                                  PathRet:
 35421 00005E08 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 35422 00005E0A C3                      	retn

 35432                                  
 35433                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 35434                                  
 35435                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 35436                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 35437                                  
 35438                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 35439                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 35440                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 35441                                  ;
 35442                                  ;	FATAL
 35443                                  ;	FATAL1
 35444                                  ;	reset_environment
 35445                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 35446                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 35447                                  ;	STATCHK
 35448                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 35449                                  ;	DIVOV
 35450                                  ;	CHARHARD
 35451                                  ;	HardErr
 35452                                  ;
 35453                                  ;	Revision history:
 35454                                  ;
 35455                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 35456                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 35457                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 35458                                  ;
 35459                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 35460                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 35461                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 35462                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 35463                                  ;
 35464                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 35465                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 35466                                  ;	      charhard.
 35467                                  
 35468                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35469                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35470                                  ;		public	LowInt23Addr		
 35471                                  LowInt23Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 35472 00005E0B [F60F]0000              	DW	LowInt23, 0
 35473                                  
 35474                                  ;		public	LowInt24Addr
 35475                                  LowInt24Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 35476 00005E0F [0A10]0000              	DW	LowInt24, 0
 35477                                  
 35478                                  ;		public	LowInt28Addr
 35479                                  LowInt28Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 35480 00005E13 [1E10]0000              	DW	LowInt28, 0
 35481

 35842                                  	; !! NOTE: FALL THROUGH !!
 35843                                  
 35844                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35845                                  ;
 35846                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35847                                  ;
 35848                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35849                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35850                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35851                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35852                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35853                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35854                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35855                                  ; is simulated.
 35856                                  ;
 35857                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35858                                  
 35859                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35860                                  
 35861                                  CNTCHAND:
 35862                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35863                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35864                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35865                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35866                                  
 35867                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35868                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35869 00005F53 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35870 00005F59 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35871                                  
 35872 00005F5B B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35873 00005F5D E865BD                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35874 00005F60 E8FABB                          CALL	CRLF
 35875                                  around_deadlock:
 35876 00005F63 16                              PUSH    SS
 35877 00005F64 1F                              POP     DS
 35878 00005F65 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35879 00005F6A 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35880 00005F6C E8EFDB                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35881                                  NOSWAP:
 35882 00005F6F FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35883 00005F70 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35884 00005F74 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35885 00005F78 E8C6A4                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35886                                  
 35887                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35888                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35889                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35890                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35891                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35892                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35893                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35894                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35895                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35896                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35897                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35898                                  			; else
 35899                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35900                                  
 35901                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35902                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35903                                  
 35904                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35905                                  	
 35906 00005F7B 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35907                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35908 00005F7C 1E                      	push	ds
 35909                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35910 00005F7D 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35911 00005F82 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35912                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35913                                  	;;;
 35914 00005F87 C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35915                                  	;;;
 35916 00005F8C C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35917 00005F91 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35918                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35919 00005F95 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35920                                  
 35921 00005F9A 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35922 00005F9F 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35923 00005FA0 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35924 00005FA2 F8                      	CLC				
 35925 00005FA3 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35926 00005FA5 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35927                                  
 35928                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35929                                  do_low_int23:
 35930 00005FA7 F8                      	clc
 35931 00005FA8 2EFF1E[0B5E]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35932                                  
 35933                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35934                                  
 35935                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35936                                  
 35937                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35938                                  ;
 35939                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35940                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35941                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35942                                  ;
 35943                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35944                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35945                                  
 35946                                  ctrlc_ret_addr: ; 05/05/2019
 35947                                  
 35948 00005FAD FA                      	CLI
 35949                                  
 35950                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 
 35951                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_IN_AX],ax	; save the AX
 35952                                  	;PUSHF				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35953                                  	;POP	AX
 35954                                  
 35955                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35956                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35957                                  
 35958                                  	; We have to use DOSDATA for these variables. Previously CS was used 
 35959                                  
 35960 00005FAE 50                      	push	ax
 35961 00005FAF 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 35962                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35963 00005FB1 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35964 00005FB6 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 35965 00005FB9 58                      	pop	ax
 35966 00005FBA A3[3A03]                	MOV	[USER_IN_AX],ax		; save the AX
 35967 00005FBD 9C                      	pushf				; and the flags (maybe new call)
 35968 00005FBE 58                      	pop	ax
 35969                                  
 35970                                  ; See if the input stack is identical to the output stack
 35971                                  
 35972                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35973                                  	;CMP	SP,[CS:ConC_Spsave]
 35974                                  	;JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35975                                  
 35976                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35977 00005FBF 3B26[3203]              	CMP	SP,[ConC_Spsave]
 35978 00005FC3 750A                    	JNZ	SHORT ctrlc_try_new	; current SP not the same as saved SP
 35979                                  
 35980                                  ; Repeat the operation by redispatching the system call.
 35981                                  
 35982                                  ctrlc_repeat:
 35983                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35984                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]
 35985                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35986                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35987 00005FC5 A1[3A03]                	mov	ax,[USER_IN_AX]
 35988 00005FC8 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds and original sp
 35989                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0 
 35990                                  	;transfer COMMAND
 35991                                  COMMANDJ:
 35992 00005FCC E922A3                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35993                                  
 35994                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35995                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35996                                  
 35997                                  ctrlc_try_new:
 35998                                  	; 29/02/2024
 35999                                  	;ADD	SP,2			; pop those flags
 36000                                  	;
 36001                                  	;;test	ax,1
 36002                                  	;TEST	AX,f_Carry		; did he return with carry?
 36003 00005FCF A801                    	test	al,f_Carry ; test al,1
 36004                                  	;
 36005                                  	; 29/02/2024
 36006 00005FD1 58                      	pop	ax  ;  (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36007                                  	;
 36008 00005FD2 74F1                    	JZ	short ctrlc_repeat	; no carry set, just retry
 36009                                  
 36010                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36011 00005FD4 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]		; restore ds
 36012                                  
 36013                                  	; Well...  time to abort the user.  
 36014                                  	; Signal a ^C exit and use the EXIT system call..
 36015                                  
 36016                                  ctrlc_abort:
 36017                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36018                                          ;;MOV	AX,(EXIT SHL 8) + 0
 36019                                          ;MOV	AX,(EXIT*256) + 0  ; 4C00h
 36020                                  	;mov	byte [CS:DidCTRLC],0FFh ; 14/03/2018
 36021                                          ;transfer COMMAND	    ; give up by faking $EXIT
 36022                                  	;;JMP	SHORT COMMANDJ
 36023                                  	;JMP	COMMAND
 36024                                  
 36025                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36026                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36027 00005FD8 B8004C                  	MOV	AX,(EXIT<<8)+0 ; 4C00h

 36210                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36211                                  ;
 36212                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 36213                                  ;
 36214                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 36215                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 36216                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 36217                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 36218                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 36219                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 36220                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36221                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 36222                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 36223                                  ; Output:
 36224                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 36225                                  ;
 36226                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36227                                  
 36228                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 36230                                  HARDERR:
 36231                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36232                                  	; 30/07/2018
 36233                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 36241 00006072 50                      	PUSH	AX

 36244                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]

 36354                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the

 36365 0000610B BF0C00                  	MOV	DI,error_I24_gen_failure; mapped to gen_failure. Real codes
 36366                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError

 36368                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 36369                                  ;
 36370                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 36371                                  ;
 36372                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 36373                                  ;
 36374                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 36375                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.

 36377                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 36378                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 36379                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 36380 0000610E 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24

 36383 00006118 EB76                    	JMP	short FailRet
 36384                                  NoSetFail:

 36386 0000611F 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36387 00006120 07                      	POP	ES
 36388                                      
 36389                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 36390                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 36391                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 36392                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 36393

 36395 00006127 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree

 36400 00006133 5E                      	pop	si

 36405                                  					; Prepare to play with stack

 36415

 36421                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 36423 0000614F EB29                    	JMP	short passi24 		; AN000;IFS.exit
 36424                                  i24yes: 				; AN000;

 36426

 36454                                  	;;;

 36459 0000618F FB                      	STI
 36460                                  FailRet:
 36461 00006190 36C42E[8005]            	LES	BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 36462                                  	
 36463                                  	; 08/07/2018
 36464                                  
 36465                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 36466                                  
 36467 00006195 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 36468 00006197 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore
 36469 00006199 7445                    	JZ	short CheckRetry	; 1 => retry

 36472

 36474                                  
 36475                                  					; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,
 36476                                  					; ALLOWED, FAILERR, WPERR, SFN, pJFN

 36482                                  					; AN000;EO. I24 error disabled
 36483                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36484                                  	;(MSDOS 6.0, MSCTRLC.ASM, 1991)
 36485 000061A9 36F606[F605]02          	test	byte [ss:EXTOPEN_ON],EXT_OPEN_I24_OFF ; 2
 36486 000061AF 7505                    	jnz	short CleanUp 		; AN000;EO. no
 36487                                  	
 36488 000061B1 36FE06[4A03]            	inc	byte [SS:FAILERR]	; Tell everybody
 36489                                  CleanUp:
 36490 000061B6 36C606[2203]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:WPERR],-1
 36491 000061BC 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1
 36492                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36493                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2
 36494                                  	;retn
 36495                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36496 000061C2 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36497                                  CleanUp2:
 36498 000061C4 1E                      	push	ds
 36499 000061C5 56                      	push	si
 36500 000061C6 50                      	push	ax
 36501 000061C7 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]
 36502 000061CB 36C536[AE05]            	LDS	SI,[ss:PJFN]
 36503 000061D0 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL
 36504 000061D2 58                      	pop	ax
 36505 000061D3 5E                      	pop	si
 36506 000061D4 1F                      	pop	ds
 36507                                  Cleanup_retn:
 36508 000061D5 C3                      	retn
 36509                                  
 36510                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 36511                                  
 36512                                  CheckIgnore:
 36513                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 36514 000061D6 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 36515                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024
 36516 000061DC 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 36517 000061DE EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 36518                                  
 36519                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 36520

 36525                                  	;JMP	short CleanUp
 36526                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 36528                                  	
 36529                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 36530                                  DoAbort:
 36531 000061E8 16                      	push	ss
 36532 000061E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 36533

 36535 000061EF 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 36536 000061F1 E86AD9                  	call	SWAPBACK
 36537                                  NOSWAP2:
 36538                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 36539                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 36540                                  
 36541                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 36542                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 36543

 36545 000061F9 75AC                    	JNZ	short DoFail

 36548                                  
 36549 000061FB C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 36550 00006200 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 36551                                  
 36552                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 36553                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 36554                                  
 36555 00006202 E97010                  	jmp	exit_inner
 36556                                  
 36557                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36558                                  ;
 36559                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 36560                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 36561                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 36562                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 36563                                  ;
 36564                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 36565                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 36566                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 36567                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 36568                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 36569                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 36570                                  ;
 36571                                  ; output:   none.
 36572                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36573                                  
 36574                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 36575                                  	
 36576                                  reset_environment:
 36577                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36578                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 36579                                  
 36580                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 36581                                  
 36582 00006205 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 36583                                  
 36584                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 36585                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 36586                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 36587                                  
 36588 00006206 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 36589                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 36590                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 36591 00006208 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 36592                                  
 36593                                  					; SS override
 36594 0000620A 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 36595                                  
 36596                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 36597                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 36598                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 36599                                  					; On process exit.
 36600 00006210 B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 36601 00006213 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 36602                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 36603                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 36604 00006215 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 36605 00006217 E84FAD                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 36606                                  
 36607 0000621A 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 36608 0000621B 06                      	push	es
 36609 0000621C 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 36610                                  
 36611 0000621D 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 36612 00006222 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 36613 00006224 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 36614                                  
 36615                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 36616                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 36617                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 36618                                  	
 36619 00006227 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 36620 00006229 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 36621 0000622B 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 36622 0000622D 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 36623 0000622F 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 36624                                  
 36625                                  					; SS override
 36626                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 36627 00006230 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 36628 00006236 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 36629                                  
 36630                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 36631                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 36632                                  
 36633                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 36634 00006238 E87910                  	call	arena_free_process
 36635                                  
 36636                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 36637                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 36638                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 36639                                  
 36640                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 36641 0000623B E86ED4                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 36642                                  
 36643                                  reset_to_parent:
 36644                                  					; SS override
 36645 0000623E 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 36646                                  
 36647                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 36648                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 36649 00006243 16                      	push	ss
 36650 00006244 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36651                                  
 36652 00006245 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 36653                                  
 36654                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 36655                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 36656                                  
 36657                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 36658 00006247 E898B6                  	call	ECritDisk
 36659                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 36660 0000624A E85F08                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 36661                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 36662 0000624D E8BFB6                  	call	LCritDisk
 36663                                  
 36664                                  ; 29/02/2024 - Retrto DOS v5.0

 36668

 36670                                  %endif
 36671                                  
 36672 00006250 FA                      	CLI
 36673 00006251 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 36674

 36676                                  	;;;

 36678                                  	;;;
 36679

 36682 00006265 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]

 36686

 36691 00006279 E8C5A1                  	call	restore_world
 36692                                  
 36693                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36694 0000627C 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 36695                                  
 36696                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36697 0000627D 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG
 36698 0000627E 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.
 36699                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata

 36702 00006288 58                      	pop	ax

 36708 0000628D 58                      	POP	AX

 36720 00006294 B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h

 36726

 36728                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]

 36740 000062A6 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 36741                                  
 36742                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36743                                  ;
 36744                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 36745                                  ;
 36746                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 36747                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 36748                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 36749                                  ;
 36750                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36751                                  
 36752                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 36753 000062A7 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36754                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 36755 000062A8 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 36756 000062AB 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 36757                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 36758                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 36759                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36760                                  	
 36761                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36762 000062AE 1E                      	push	ds

 36764 000062AF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36765                                  
 36766                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 36767                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 36768                                  
 36769 000062B4 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 36770 000062B6 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 36771 000062B8 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 36772

 36774 000062BA 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36775 000062BE 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH

 36784                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.

 36788 000062C6 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 36789 000062C9 E8E5A3                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 36790 000062CC 5E                      	POP	SI
