 38880                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38881                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38882                                  ;
 38883                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38884                                  ; Inputs:
 38885                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38886                                  ; Function:
 38887                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38888                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38889                                  ;	   same segment
 38890                                  ;
 38891                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38892                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38893                                  ; No Registers altered
 38894                                  ;
 38895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38896                                  
 38897                                  POINTCOMP:
 38898                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38899                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38900 00006926 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38901 00006928 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38902                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38903 0000692A 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38904 0000692B 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38905 0000692C 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38906 0000692E 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38907 00006930 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38908 00006932 5A                      	POP	DX
 38909 00006933 59                      	POP	CX
 38910                                  _ret_label:
 38911 00006934 C3                      	retn
 38912                                  
 38913                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38914                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38915                                  
 38916                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38917                                  
 38918                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38919                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38920                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38921                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38922                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38923                                  ; 
 38924                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38925                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38926                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38927                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38928                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38929                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38930                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38931                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38932                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38933                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38934                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38935                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38936                                  
 38937                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38938                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38939                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38940                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38941                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38942                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38943                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38944                                  ; 
 38945                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38946                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38947                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38948                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38949                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38950                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38951                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38952                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38953                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38954                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38955                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38956                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38957                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38958                                  
 38959                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 39936                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39937                                  
 39938                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39939                                  
 39940                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39941                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39942                                  
 39943                                  ; =========================================================================
 39944                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39945                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39946                                  ;
 39947                                  ;	$WAIT
 39948                                  ;	$EXEC
 39949                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39950                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39951                                  ;	$EXIT
 39952                                  ;	$ABORT
 39953                                  ;	abort_inner
 39954                                  ;
 39955                                  ;	Modification history:
 39956                                  ;
 39957                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39958                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39959                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39960                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39961                                  ;
 39962                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39963                                  ;
 39964                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39965                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39966                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39967                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39968                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39969                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39970                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39971                                  ;
 39972                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39973                                  ;
 39974                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39975                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39976                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39977                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39978                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39979                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39980                                  ;
 39981                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39982                                  ;
 39983                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39984                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39985                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39986                                  ;
 39987                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39988                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39989                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39990                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39991                                  ;
 39992                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39993                                  ;
 39994                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39995                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39996                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39997                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39998                                  ;
 39999                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 40000                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 40001                                  ;		       UMBs.
 40002                                  ;
 40003                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 40004                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 40005                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 40006                                  ;
 40007                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 40008                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 40009                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 40010                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 40011                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 40012                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 40013                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 40014                                  ;
 40015                                  ; =========================================================================
 40016

 40018

 40024                                  ;

 40041

 40044                                  
 40045                                  _$WAIT:
 40046                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40047                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 40048                                  
 40049 00006BF2 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX

 40053                                  ; =========================================================================
 40054                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 40055                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 40056                                  ;
 40057                                  ;
 40058                                  ; Assembler usage:
 40059                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 40060                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 40061                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 40062                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 40063                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 40064                                  ;
 40065                                  ;	AL  Function
 40066                                  ;	--  --------
 40067                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 40068                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 40069                                  ;	    begin execution.
 40070                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 40071                                  ;
 40072                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 40073                                  ;
 40074                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40075                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 40076                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 40077                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40078                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 40079                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 40080                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40081                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40082                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 40083                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40084                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40085                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 40086                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40087                                  ;
 40088                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 40089                                  ;
 40090                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40091                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 40092                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 40093                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40094                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 40095                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 40096                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40097                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40098                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 40099                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40100                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 40101                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 40102                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40103                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 40104                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 40105                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40106                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 40107                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 40108                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40109                                  ;
 40110                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 40111                                  ;
 40112                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40113                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 40114                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 40115                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40116                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 40117                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 40118                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 40119                                  ;
 40120                                  ; Returns:
 40121                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 40122                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 40123                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 40124                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 40125                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 40126                                  ; =========================================================================
 40127                                  ;
 40128                                  ;   Revision history:
 40129                                  ;
 40130                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 40131                                  ;
 40132                                  ; =========================================================================
 40133                                  
 40134                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 40135                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 40136

 40144                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128

 40146                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 40147                                  ;ENDIF

 40168                                  _$EXEC:
 40169                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40170                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 40171                                  
 40172                                  EXEC001S:
 40173                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 40174                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 40175                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 40176                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 40177                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 40178                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 40179                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 40180                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 40181                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 40182                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 40183                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 40184                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 40185                                  	;
 40186                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 40187                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 40188                                  
 40189                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 40190                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 40191                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 40192                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 40193                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 40194                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 40195                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 40196                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 40197                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 40198                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 40199                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 40200                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 40201                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 40202                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 40203                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 40204                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 40205                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 40206                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 40207                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 40208                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40209                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 40210                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 40211                                  	
 40212                                  	; ==================================================================
 40213                                  	; validate function
 40214                                  	; ==================================================================
 40215                                  		      	
 40216                                  	; M068 - Start
 40217                                  	;
 40218                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 40219                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 40220                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 40221                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 40222                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 40223                                  
 40224                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40225 00006BFC 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 40226                                  
 40227                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 40228                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 40229                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 40230                                  
 40231 00006C02 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 40232                                  	;jne	short @f
 40233 00006C04 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue

 41251                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 41252                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 41253                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 41254                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie

 41256                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay

 41809                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41810                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41811                                  ;
 41812                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41813                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41814                                  ;
 41815                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41816                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41817                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41818                                  ;

 41830                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41831 00007226 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41832                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41833 00007227 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41834 0000722D 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41835 00007232 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41836 00007235 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41837                                  
 41838 00007237 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41839

 41842 0000723C 53                      	push	BX

 41844 0000723E E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41845 00007241 1F                      	pop	DS
 41846 00007242 5B                      	pop	BX
 41847 00007243 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41848                                  
 41849 00007245 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41850 00007247 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41851                                  	;mov	[2],ax

 41853

 41912                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41913                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41914                                  ; Inputs:
 41915                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41916                                  ; Function:
 41917                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41918                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41919                                  ; Returns:
 41920                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41921                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 41923                                  _$ABORT:
 41924 00007282 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41925                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0

 41928                                  
 41929                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41930                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41931                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41932

 42148                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 42149                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42150                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 42151                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42152                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 42153                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 42154                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42155                                  
 42156                                  arena_next:
 42157 000072E6 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 42158 000072E8 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 42159 000072EC 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 42160                                  
 42161                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 42162                                  ;
 42163                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 42164                                  ;       RETN
 42165                                  
 42166                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 42167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42168                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 42169                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42170                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 42171                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 42172                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 42173                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 42174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42175                                  
 42176                                  check_signature:        
 42177                                  
 42178 000072ED 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 42179                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 42180 000072EF 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 42181                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 42182 000072F3 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42183                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42184 000072F5 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 42185                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 42186 000072F9 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42187 000072FB F9                              STC                             ; set error
 42188                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 42189                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 42190                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 42191                                  check_signature_ok:
 42192                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 42193 000072FC C3                      	RETN
 42194                                  
 42195                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 42196                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42197                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 42198                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 42199                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 42200                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 42201                                  ;
 42202                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 42203                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42204                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42205                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 42206                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 42207                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 42208                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 42209                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42210                                          
 42211                                  Coalesce:
 42212                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42213 000072FD 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 42214                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 42215                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 42216 00007300 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 42217 00007302 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 42218                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 42219 00007305 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 42220                                  
 42221                                  coalesce_check:
 42222                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 42223 00007307 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 42224                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 42225 0000730C 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 42226                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 42227 0000730E 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 42228 00007313 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 42229                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 42230 00007314 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 42231 00007318 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 42232 0000731B 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 42233 0000731D EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again

 42235                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42236                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 42237                                  
 42238                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 42239                                  
 42240                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42241                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42242                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 42243                                  ;
 42244                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 42245                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 42246                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 42247                                  ;
 42248                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 42249                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 42250                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 42251                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 42252                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 42253                                  ;
 42254                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 42255                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 42256                                  ;
 42257                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42258                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42259                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42260                                  ;           INT     21h
 42261                                  ;
 42262                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 42263                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 42264                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 42265                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 42266                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 42267                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 42268                                  ;
 42269                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 42270                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 42271                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 42272                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 42273                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 42274                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 42275                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 42276                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 42277                                  ;	USES	All
 42278                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42279                                  
 42280                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42282                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 42283                                  ;
 42284                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42285                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42286                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42287                                  ;           INT     21h
 42288                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 42289                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 42290                                  ;
 42291                                  ;   Description:
 42292                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 42293                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 42294                                  ;
 42295                                  ;   Error return:
 42296                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 42297                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42298                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42299                                  
 42300                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42301

 42639                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42640                                  
 42641                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42643                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 42644                                  ;
 42645                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 42646                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 42647                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 42648                                  ;
 42649                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 42650                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 42651                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 42652                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 42653                                  ;
 42654                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 42655                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 42656                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 42657                                  ;		code.
 42658                                  ;
 42659                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 42660                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 42661                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 42662                                  ;
 42663                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42664                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42665                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 42666                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 42667                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 42668                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 42669                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 42670                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 42671                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42672                                  
 42673                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42674                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42675                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42676                                  ;
 42677                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42678                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 42679                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 42680                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 42681                                  ;           INT     21h
 42682                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 42683                                  ;         size possible
 42684                                  ;   Error return:
 42685                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 42686                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42687                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 42688                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 42689                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42690                                  
 42691                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 42692                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42693                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 42694 00007470 E86FA4                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 42695                                  
 42696 00007473 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 42697 00007476 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 42698 00007478 48                              DEC     AX
 42699 00007479 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 42700 0000747C 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 42701                                  
 42702                                  setblock_bad:
 42703 0000747E E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 42704                                  
 42705                                  setblock_grab:
 42706 00007481 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 42707 00007483 E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 42708 00007486 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 42709 00007488 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 42710 0000748C 51                              PUSH    CX
 42711 0000748D 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 42712 0000748F 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 42713 00007491 E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 42786                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42787                                  
 42788                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42790                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42791                                  ;
 42792                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42793                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42794                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42795                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42796                                  ;           INT     21h
 42797                                  ;
 42798                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42799                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42800                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42801                                  ;
 42802                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42803                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42804                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42805                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42806                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42807                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42808                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42809                                  ;
 42810                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42811                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42812                                  ;
 42813                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42814                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42815                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42816                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42817                                  ;
 42818                                  ;
 42819                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42820                                  ;
 42821                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42822                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42823                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42824                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42825                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42826                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42827                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42828                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42829                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42830                                  ;
 42831                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42832                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42833                                  ;
 42834                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42835                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42836                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42837                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42838                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42839                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42840                                  
 42841                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42842                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42843                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42844                                  ;
 42845                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42846                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42847                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42848                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42849                                  ;           INT     21h
 42850                                  ;
 42851                                  ;   Error return:
 42852                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42853                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 43081                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 43082                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 43083                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 43084                                  ;		   else
 43085                                  ;			DS = last arena
 43086                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 43087                                  ;
 43088                                  ;		   CY if error
 43089                                  ;
 43090                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 43091                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43092                                  
 43093                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43094                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43095                                  
 43096                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43097                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 43098                                  
 43099                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43100                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 43101                                  
 43102                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 43103                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 43104                                  
 43105                                  GetLastArena:
 43106 00007539 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 43107                                  
 43108 0000753A 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 43109 0000753E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 43110 00007540 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 43111                                  
 43112 00007542 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 43113                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 43114 00007546 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 43115                                  
 43116                                  GLA_next:
 43117 00007548 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 43118 0000754A E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 43119                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43120                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 43121                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43122 0000754D 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 43123                                  
 43124                                  ; 10/03/2024
 43125                                  %if 0
 43126                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 43127                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 43128                                  					;    umb_head
 43129                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 43130                                  %else
 43131                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43132                                  	;;;
 43133 0000754F E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 43134 00007552 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 43135                                  	;;;
 43136                                  %endif
 43137 00007554 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 43138                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 43139 00007558 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 43140                                  GLA_chkumb:
 43141 0000755A 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 43142                                  GLA_@f:
 43143 0000755C 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 43144                                  
 43145                                  GLA_done:
 43146                                  
 43147                                  ; 10/03/2024
 43148                                  %if 0
 43149                                  					; M061 - Start
 43150                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 43151                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 43152                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 43153                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 43154                                  %else
 43155                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43156                                  	;;;
 43157 0000755E E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 43158 00007561 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 43159                                  	;;;
 43160                                  %endif
 43161 00007563 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 43162 00007565 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 43163                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 43164 00007568 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 43165 0000756A 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 43166 0000756C 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 43167                                  					; M061 - End
 43168                                  GLA_ret:
 43169                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43170                                  	;clc
 43171                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43172                                  	;clc
 43173 0000756E 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 43174 0000756F C3                      	retn				; M061
 43175                                  
 43176                                  GLA_err:
 43177 00007570 F9                      	stc				; M061
 43178                                  GLA_err2:
 43179 00007571 58                      	pop	ax
 43180                                  
 43181                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 43182                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43183                                  	;;;
 43184 00007572 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 43185 00007573 E87A9D                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 43186 00007576 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 43187                                  	;;;
 43188                                  
 43189                                  	; 10/03/2024
 43190                                  	;retn

 43258                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43259                                  ;
 43260                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 43261                                  ;
 43262                                  ; Inputs:
 43263                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 43264                                  ; Function:
 43265                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 43266                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 43267                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 43268                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 43269                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 43270                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 43271                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 43272                                  ;			CX User Index
 43273                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 43274                                  ;			BX = UID
 43275                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 43276                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 43277                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 43278                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 43279                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 43280                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 43281                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 43282                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 43283                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 43284                                  ;
 43285                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43286                                  
 43287                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43288                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 43289

 43553                                  ;Break	<$SetExtendedError - set extended error for later retrieval>
 43554                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43555                                  ;
 43556                                  ; Procedure Name : $SetExtendedError
 43557                                  ;
 43558                                  ; $SetExtendedError takes extended error information and loads it up for the
 43559                                  ; next extended error call. This is used by interrupt-level proccessors to
 43560                                  ; mask their actions.
 43561                                  ;
 43562                                  ;   Inputs: DS:SI points to DPL which contains all registers
 43563                                  ;   Outputs: none
 43564                                  ;
 43565                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43566                                  
 43567                                  _$SetExtendedError:
 43568                                  
 43569                                  ;hkn; SS override for all variables used
 43570                                  
 43571 000076A6 8B04                    	mov	ax,[si]
 43572                                  	;MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.AX]
 43573 000076A8 36A3[2403]              	MOV	[SS:EXTERR],AX
 43574                                  	;mov	ax,[si+10]
 43575 000076AC 8B440A                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.DI]
 43576 000076AF 36A3[2803]              	MOV	[SS:EXTERRPT],AX
 43577                                  	;mov	ax,[si+14]
 43578 000076B3 8B440E                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.ES]
 43579 000076B6 36A3[2A03]              	MOV	[SS:EXTERRPT+2],AX
 43580                                  	;mov	ax,[si+2]
 43581 000076BA 8B4402                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.BX]
 43582 000076BD 36A3[2603]              	MOV	[SS:EXTERR_ACTION],AX
 43583                                  	;mov	ax,[si+4]
 43584 000076C1 8B4404                  	MOV	AX,[SI+DPL.CX]
 43585 000076C4 368826[2303]            	MOV	[SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],AH
 43586 000076C9 C3                      	retn
