 43608                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 43609                                  
 43610                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 43611                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43612                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 43613                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 43614                                  ;
 43615                                  ;	NOTE:
 43616                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43617                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43618                                  ;
 43619                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43620                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 43621                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 43622                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43623                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43624                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 43625                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43626                                  
 43627                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43628                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43629                                  
 43630                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 43631                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43632                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43633 000076CA 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43634                                  	
 43635                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 43636 000076CF 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 43637                                  
 43638                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 43639 000076D4 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 43640 000076D9 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 43641                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43642                                  	;mov	al,6
 43643 000076DB B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43644                                  ReturnCarry:
 43645 000076DD F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 43646 000076DE C3                      	retn				; go back
 43647                                  pjfn10: 
 43648                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 43649 000076DF 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 43650 000076E4 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 43651                                  	;clc
 43652                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 43653 000076E6 C3                      	retn
 43654                                  
 43655                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 43656                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43657                                  ;
 43658                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 43659                                  ;
 43660                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 43661                                  ;
 43662                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 43663                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 43664                                  ;                   AX has error code
 43665                                  ;               Carry Reset
 43666                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 43667                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 43668                                  ; NOTE:
 43669                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43670                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43671                                  ;
 43672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43673                                  
 43674                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43675                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43676                                  
 43677                                  SFFromHandle:
 43678 000076E7 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 43679                                  	;retc				; return if error
 43680 000076EA 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 43681 000076EC 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 43682                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43683                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43684                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43685                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43686                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43687                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43688 000076F0 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 43689                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43690                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43691                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43692                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43693                                  GetSF:
 43694 000076F2 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 43695 000076F3 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 43696 000076F6 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 43697 000076F8 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 43698 000076FB 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 43699 000076FC C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 43700                                  
 43701                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 43702                                  
 43703                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 43704                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43705                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 43706                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 43707                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 43708                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 43709                                  ;
 43710                                  ;   NOTE:
 43711                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 43712                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43713                                  ;
 43714                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 43715                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43716                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 43717                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 43718                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 43719                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43720                                  
 43721                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43722                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43723                                  
 43724                                  SFFromSFN:
 43725                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43726                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43727 000076FD 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43728                                  
 43729                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 43730 00007702 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 43731                                  sfsfn5:	
 43732                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 43733 00007707 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 43734 0000770B 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 43735                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 43736 0000770D 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 43737 00007711 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 43738                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43739 00007714 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43740 00007717 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43741 00007719 F9                      	STC
 43742 0000771A C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43743                                  sfsfn7:
 43744 0000771B 50                      	push	ax
 43745                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43746                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43747                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43748                                  	
 43749                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43750 0000771C B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43751                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43752                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43753                                  	
 43754 0000771E F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43755 00007720 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43756 00007722 58                      	pop	ax
 43757                                  	;add	di,6
 43758 00007723 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43759 00007726 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43760                                  
 43761                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43762                                  
 43763                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43764                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43765                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43766                                  ;
 43767                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43768                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43769                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43770                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43771                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43772                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43773                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43774                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43775                                  
 43776                                  JFNFree:
 43777 00007727 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43778                                  jfnf1:	
 43779 00007729 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43780 0000772C 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43781 0000772E 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43782 00007732 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43783 00007734 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43784 00007735 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43785                                  
 43786                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43787                                  jfnf5:	
 43788                                  	;mov	al,4
 43789 00007737 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43790                                  jfnfx:	
 43791 00007739 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43792                                  
 43793                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43794                                  
 43795                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43796                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43797                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43798                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43799                                  ;
 43800                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43801                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43802                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43803                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43804                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43805                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43806                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43807                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43808                                  ;
 43809                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43810                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43811                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43812                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43813                                  ;
 43814                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43815                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43816                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43817                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43818                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43819                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43820                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43821                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43822                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43823                                  
 43824                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43825                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43826                                  
 43827                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43828                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43829                                  
 43830                                  SFNFree:
 43831                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43832                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43833                                  	;
 43834                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43835 0000773A 50                      	push	ax
 43836 0000773B 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43837                                  sfnf5:	
 43838 0000773D 53                      	push	bx
 43839 0000773E E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43840 00007741 5B                      	pop	bx
 43841 00007742 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43842 00007744 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43843                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43844 00007748 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43845                                  	
 43846                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43847 0000774A 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43848                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43849 0000774E 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43850                                  sfnf7:	
 43851 00007750 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43852 00007751 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43853                                  
 43854                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43855                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43856                                  ;
 43857                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43858                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43859                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43860                                  
 43861                                  sfnf10:	
 43862 00007753 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43863                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43864 00007757 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43865 0000775B 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43866 0000775D 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43867                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43868 00007761 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43869 00007765 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43870                                  
 43871                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43872                                  ;
 43873                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43874                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43875                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43876                                  
 43877                                  sfnf20:
 43878                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43879                                  
 43880                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43881 00007767 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43882                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43883                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43884                                  
 43885 0000776C 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43886                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43887 00007770 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43888 00007774 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43889                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43890 00007778 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43891                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43892                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43893                                  	;pop	ax
 43894                                  	;;clc
 43895                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43896                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43897 0000777C 58                      	pop	ax
 43898                                  	;clc
 43899 0000777D C3                      	retn
 43900                                  
 43901                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43902                                  ;
 43903                                  ;	'C' set
 43904                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43905                                  
 43906                                  sfnf95: 
 43907 0000777E 58                      	pop	ax
 43908                                  
 43909                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43910                                  %if 0
 43911                                  	;mov	al,4
 43912                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43913                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43914                                  %else
 43915                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43916                                  	;;;
 43917 0000777F EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43918                                  	;;;
 43919                                  %endif

 43921                                  ;============================================================================
 43922                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 43923                                  ;============================================================================
 43924                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43925                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43926                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 43927                                  
 43928                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43929                                  
 43930                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43931                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43932                                  ;
 43933                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43934                                  ;
 43935                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43936                                  ;		path
 43937                                  ;
 43938                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43939                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43940                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43941                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43942                                  ;
 43943                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43944                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43945                                  ;	USES	all
 43946                                  ;
 43947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43948                                  
 43949                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43950                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43951                                  
 43952                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43953                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43954                                  
 43955                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43956                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43957                                  
 43958                                  _$CLOSE:
 43959                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43960                                  
 43961 00007781 E8F702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43962 00007784 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43963 00007786 16                      	push	ss
 43964 00007787 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43965 00007788 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43966 0000778C 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43967                                  
 43968                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43969                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43970                                  ;
 43971                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43972                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43973                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43974                                  
 43975                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 43976 00007790 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 43977 00007794 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 43978                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 43979 00007796 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 43980                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 43981 0000779A 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 43982                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 43983 0000779C 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 43984 0000779E 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 43985                                  
 43986                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43987                                  ; -1.
 43988                                  
 43989                                  FreeJFN:
 43990 000077A0 E827FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; d = pJFN (handle);
 43991 000077A3 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 43992                                  PostFree:
 43993                                  
 43994                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 43995                                  
 43996 000077A7 E87ABF                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 43997                                  
 43998                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 43999                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 44000                                  
 44001 000077AA 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 44002                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 44003 000077AC B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 44004                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44005                                  CloseOk:
 44006 000077AE E9BD8E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 44007                                  CloseError:
 44008                                  CommitError:	; 11/03/2024
 44009 000077B1 E9C48E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 44010                                  
 44011                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 44012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44013                                  ;
 44014                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 44015                                  ;
 44016                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 44017                                  ;	flushed out. BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 44018                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 44019                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 44020                                  ;
 44021                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 44022                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 44023                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 44024                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44025                                  ;
 44026                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 44027                                  ;	EXIT	none
 44028                                  ;	USES	all
 44029                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44030                                  
 44031                                  _$COMMIT:
 44032                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 44033                                  
 44034 000077B4 E8C402                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 44035                                  	;JC	short CommitError	; error return
 44036                                  	; 11/03/2024
 44037 000077B7 72F8                    	jc	short CommitError
 44038                                  
 44039 000077B9 16                      	push	ss
 44040 000077BA 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT

 44643                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 44644                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44645                                  ;
 44646                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44647                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44648                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 44649                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44650                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 44651                                  ;   Errors:
 44652                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 44653                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 44654                                  ;
 44655                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44656                                  
 44657                                  	; 12/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44658                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BBEBh
 44659

 44662

 44689                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 44690                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44691                                  ;
 44692                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44693                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44694                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 44695                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 44696                                  ;	    INT     int_command

 44698                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle

 44704 0000796E 51                      	push	cx			; save source

 44714                                  ;
 44715                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44716                                  ;	    MOV AH, FileTimes (57H)
 44717                                  ;	    MOV AL, func
 44718                                  ;	    MOV BX, handle

 44720                                  ;	    MOV CX, time
 44721                                  ;	    MOV DX, date

 44724                                  ;	; for the handle.

 44726                                  ;	AL=02		 get extended attributes

 44728                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44729                                  ;	   DS:SI query list (si=-1, selects all EA)
 44730                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold EA list

 44732                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list
 44733                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44734                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44735                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold name list
 44736                                  ;
 44737                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 44738                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44739                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list

 44741                                  ;
 44742                                  ;   Error returns:
 44743                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function

 45059                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 45060                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45061                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 45062                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 45063                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 45064                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 45065                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 45066                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 45067                                  ;
 45068                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 45069                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 45070                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 45071                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 45072                                  ;	USES	none
 45073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45074                                  
 45075                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45076                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45077                                  CheckOwner:
 45078                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45079                                  
 45080 00007A7B E869FC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 45081 00007A7E 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 45082                                  
 45083 00007A80 50                      	push	ax
 45084                                  
 45085                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45086

 45088                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.
 45089

 45091 00007A87 7404                    	jz	short no_win386		;win386 is not present
 45092 00007A89 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag
 45093 00007A8B EB08                    	jmp	short _skip_win386	
 45094                                  
 45095                                  no_win386:
 45096 00007A8D 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]		;smr;SS Override
 45097                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 45098 00007A91 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 45099                                  
 45100                                  _skip_win386:
 45101 00007A95 58                      	pop	ax
 45102                                  	
 45103                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45104 00007A96 7403                    	jz	short co_ret_label

 45106                                  	;jnz	short CheckOwner_err

 45119                                  ;============================================================================
 45120                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 45121                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45122                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45123                                  
 45124                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 45125                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 45126                                  
 45127                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 45128                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 45129                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 45130                                  
 45131                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 45132                                  ;
 45133                                  ;	$AssignOper
 45134                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 45135                                  ;	InitCDS
 45136                                  ;	$UserOper
 45137                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 45138                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 45139                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 45140                                  ;
 45141                                  ;   Revision history:
 45142                                  ;
 45143                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 45144                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 45145                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 45146                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 45147                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 45148                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 45149                                  ;				    aliasing.
 45150                                  ;
 45151                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 45152                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 45153                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 45154                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 45155                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 45156                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 45157                                  ;
 45158                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 45159                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 45160                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 45161                                  ;
 45162                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 45163                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 45164                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 45165                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 45166                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 45167                                  ;
 45168                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 45169                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 45170                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 45171                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 45172                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 45173                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 45174                                  ;
 45175                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 45176                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 45177                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 45178                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 45179                                  ;   number.
 45180                                  ;
 45181                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 45182                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 45183                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 45184                                  ;   TransPath.
 45185                                  ;
 45186                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 45187                                  
 45188                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 45189                                  
 45190                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 45191                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 45192                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 45193                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 45194                                  ;					; current drive)
 45195                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 45196                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 45197                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 45198                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 45199                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 45200                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 45201                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 45202                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 45203                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 45204                                  
 45205                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 45206                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45207                                  ; Inputs:
 45208                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 45209                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 45210                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 45211                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 45212                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 45213                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 45214                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 45215                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 45216                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 45217                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 45218                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45219                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 45220                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 45221                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45222                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 45223                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 45224                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 45225                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 45226                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 45227                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 45228                                  ; Function:
 45229                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 45230                                  ; Returns:
 45231                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 45232                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45233                                  
 45234                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 45286 00007ACA B81E11                  	mov	ax,(MultNET*256)+30

 45288                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 45289                                  			; STACK: WORD function to execute

 45291                                  			; STACK unchanged

 45304                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 45305                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45307                                  ;
 45308                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 45309                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 45310                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 45311                                  ;		'C' clear

 45334                                  ;	Break <InitCDS - set up an empty CDS>
 45335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45336                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 45337                                  ;

 45339                                  ;		AL has uppercase drive letter
 45340                                  ;	EXIT	ThisCDS is now empty
 45341                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 45342                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 45343                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags
 45344                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45346                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 45404                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 45405                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45406                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 45407                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 45408                                  ;
 45409                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 45410                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 45411                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 45412                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 45413                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 45414                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 45415                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 45416                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 45417                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 45418                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 45419                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 45420                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45714                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 45715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45716                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 45717                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 45718                                  ;
 45719                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 45720                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 45721                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 45722                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 45723                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 45724                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 45725                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45727                                  
 45728                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45729                                  TransFCB:
 45730                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45731                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45732                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 45733                                  	;ENTER
 45734 00007C13 55                      	push	bp
 45735 00007C14 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45736                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45737 00007C16 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45738 00007C19 16                      	push	ss
 45739 00007C1A 07                      	pop	es
 45740 00007C1B 06                      	push	es
 45741 00007C1C 57                      	push	di
 45742                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45743                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45744 00007C1D 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45745 00007C20 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45746 00007C26 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45747 00007C2C E81BA6                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45748                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45749 00007C2F 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45750 00007C31 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45751 00007C34 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45752 00007C38 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45753                                  GetDrive:
 45754 00007C3E AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 45755 00007C3F E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 45756 00007C42 722A                    	jc	short BadPack

 45758                                  
 45759                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 45760                                  
 45761                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table

 45782 00007C5B 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45783 00007C5C 07                      	pop	es
 45784 00007C5D 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45785 00007C5E 1F                      	pop	ds

 45808                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45809                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45810                                  ;
 45811                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45812                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45813                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45814                                  ;       exactly.
 45815                                  ;
 45816                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45817                                  ;       matches splice.
 45818                                  ;
 45819                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45820                                  ;
 45821                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45822                                  ;
 45823                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45824                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45825                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45826                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45827                                  ;
 45828                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45829                                  ;
 45830                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45831                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45832                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45833                                  ;
 45834                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45835                                  ;
 45836                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45837                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45838                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45839                                  ;           splice
 45840                                  ;           fatRead
 45841                                  ;           return
 45842                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45843                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45844                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45845                                  ;           return
 45846                                  ;       if device then
 45847                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45848                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45849                                  ;           return
 45850                                  ;       if file then
 45851                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45852                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45853                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45854                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45855                                  ;           splice
 45856                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45857                                  ;           if local then
 45858                                  ;               fatread
 45859                                  ;           return
 45860                                  ;
 45861                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45862                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45863                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45864                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45865                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45866                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path

 46009                                  %if 0
 46010                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46011                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 46012                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 46013                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 46014                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 46015                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 46016                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 46017                                  ;;;
 46018                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 46019                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 46020                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 46021                                  ;;;
 46022                                  ;;;More info:
 46023                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 46024                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 46025                                  ;;;

 46027                                  start5Dhack:
 46028                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 46029                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 46030                                  
 46031                                  %endif

 46051                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS

 46100

 46135

 46137                                  
 46138 00007D70 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 46139 00007D72 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 46140 00007D76 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig

 46144                                  
 46145                                  GetOrig:
 46146 00007D79 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 46147 00007D7A 5E                      	pop	si
 46148 00007D7B 1F                      	pop	ds
 46149                                  
 46150                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 46151                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 46152                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 46154 00007D7C E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 46155 00007D7F 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 46156 00007D81 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 46157 00007D83 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 46158                                  ;
 46159                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 46160                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 46161                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 46162                                  ;
 46163 00007D85 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 46164                                  SkipPath:
 46165 00007D87 AC                      	LODSB
 46166 00007D88 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 46167 00007D8B 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 46168 00007D8D 4E                      	DEC     SI
 46169 00007D8E 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 46170 00007D90 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 46171                                  
 46172                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 46173                                  ; for yucks.
 46174                                  
 46175                                  PathAssure:
 46176 00007D92 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 46177 00007D94 AA                      	STOSB
 46178                                  
 46179                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 46180                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 46181                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 46182                                  
 46183                                  DoCanon:
 46184 00007D95 E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 46185                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 46186 00007D98 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 46187                                  
 46188                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 46189                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 46190                                  ; buffer.

 46193 00007D9B 1F                      	pop	ds

 46200

 46232                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h

 46242                                  
 46243                                  ; 13/07/2018
 46244                                  
 46245                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 46246                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46247                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 46248                                  ;
 46249                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 46250                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 46251                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 46252                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 46253                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 46254                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 46255                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 46256                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 46257                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 46258                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 46259                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46260                                  
 46261                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46262                                  
 46263                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46264                                  
 46265                                  Canonicalize:
 46266                                  
 46267                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 46268                                  
 46269 00007DEA AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 46270 00007DEB E810E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 46271 00007DEE 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 46272 00007DF0 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 46273 00007DF2 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 46274 00007DF4 AA                      	STOSB
 46275 00007DF5 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 46276                                  CanonDec:
 46277 00007DF7 4E                      	DEC     SI
 46278                                  
 46279                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 46280                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 46281                                  ; buffer.
 46282                                  
 46283                                  CanonLoop:
 46284                                  
 46285                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 46286                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 46287                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 46288                                  
 46289 00007DF8 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 46290 00007DFA 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 46291 00007DFC 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 46292 00007DFE 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 46293 00007E03 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 46294 00007E05 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 46295 00007E07 AA                      	STOSB
 46296 00007E08 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 46297                                  DoTerminate:
 46298 00007E0A AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 46299 00007E0B F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 46300 00007E0C C3                      	retn
 46301                                  
 46302                                  CanonBad:
 46303 00007E0D E8CB01                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 46304                                  	;mov	al,3
 46305 00007E10 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 46306 00007E12 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 46307                                  	;mov	al,2
 46308 00007E14 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 46309                                  PathEnc:
 46310 00007E16 F9                      	STC
 46311                                  CanonBad_retn:

 46534                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 46535                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46536                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 46537                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 46538                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 46539                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 46540                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 46541                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 46542                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 46543                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 46544                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 46545                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 46546                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 46547                                  ;                   left alone
 46548                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB

 46551

 46631                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 46632                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46633                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 46634                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 46635                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 46636                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 46637                                  ;
 46638                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 46639                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 46640                                  ;   Outputs:
 46641                                  ;       Carry Clear
 46642                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 46643                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 46644                                  ;       Carry Set
 46645                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 46646                                  ;   Registers modified: all

 46651 00007F80 56                      	push	si

 46655                                  	
 46656                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 46657                                  ; M027 - Start
 46658                                  ;
 46659                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 46660                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 46661                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 46662                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 46663                                  ; and restore CX.
 46664                                  
 46665                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 46666 00007F84 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46667 00007F86 E8E702                  	call	SetAttrib
 46668                                  
 46669                                  ; M027 - End
 46670                                  
 46671                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 46672 00007F89 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF

 46674 00007F8F 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 46675 00007F90 5F                      	pop     di
 46676 00007F91 07                      	pop	es
 46677 00007F92 5E                      	pop     si

 46721                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 46722                                  ;

 46738                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 46739                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46740                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 46741                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 46742                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 46743                                  ;
 46744                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 46745                                  ;               ES:DI string
 46746                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 46747                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 46748                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 46749                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 46750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46751                                  
 46752                                  PathPref:
 46753 00007FC2 E81298                  	call	DStrLen                 ; get length
 46754 00007FC5 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 46755 00007FC6 F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 46756 00007FC8 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 46757 00007FCA 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46758 00007FCB 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46759 00007FCE E82DDE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46760 00007FD1 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46761                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK
 46762 00007FD3 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		; get next char to match
 46763 00007FD6 E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 46764                                  Prefix:
 46765 00007FD9 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46766 00007FDA C3                      	retn
 46767                                  
 46768                                  ;Break   <ScanPathChar - see if there is a path character in a string>
 46769                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46770                                  ;     ScanPathChar - search through the string (pointed to by DS:SI) for
 46771                                  ;     a path separator.
 46772                                  ;
 46773                                  ;     Input:    DS:SI target string (null terminated)
 46774                                  ;     Output:   Zero set => path separator encountered in string
 46775                                  ;               Zero clear => null encountered
 46776                                  ;     Registers modified: SI
 46777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 46802                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46803                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46804                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46805                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46806                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46807                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46808                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46809                                  ;
 46810                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46811                                  ;       ------          --------
 46812                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46813                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46814                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46815                                  ;
 46816                                  ;   Error returns:
 46817                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46818                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46819                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46820                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46822                                  
 46823                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46824                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46826                                  ;
 46827                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46828                                  ;
 46829                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46830                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46831                                  ;
 46832                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46833                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46834                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46835                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46836                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46837                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46838                                  ;	USES	all
 46839                                  ;
 46840                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46841                                  
 46842                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46843                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46844

 47000                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already

 47109                                  ;
