 52318                                  
 52319                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 52320                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52321                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 52322                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52323                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 52324                                  ;;
 52325                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 52326                                  ;;
 52327                                  ;;	on return:
 52328                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 52329                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 52330                                  ;;
 52331                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 52332                                  ;;
 52333                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52334                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52335                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 52336                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 52337                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 52338                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 52339                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 52340                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 52341                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 52342                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 52343                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 52344                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 52345                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 52346                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 52347                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 52348                                  ;;
 52349                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52350                                  
 52351                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 52352                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block
 52353                                  
 52354                                  ;SYSINITVAR:
 52355                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52356                                  SYSINITVARS:
 52357                                  DPBHEAD:
 52358 00000026 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of DPB-FAT list
 52359                                  SFT_ADDR:
 52360 0000002A [CC000000]              	dd	SFTABL	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to first SFT table
 52361                                  BCLOCK:
 52362 0000002E 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] The CLOCK device
 52363                                  BCON:
 52364 00000032 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Console device entry points
 52365                                  MAXSEC:
 52366 00000036 8000                    	dw	128	; [SYSTEM] Maximum allowed sector size
 52367                                  BUFFHEAD:
 52368 00000038 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of buffer queue
 52369                                  CDSADDR:
 52370 0000003C 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to curdir structure table
 52371                                  SFTFCB:
 52372 00000040 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] pointer to FCB cache table
 52373                                  KEEPCOUNT:
 52374 00000044 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] count of FCB opens to keep
 52375                                  NUMIO:
 52376 00000046 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] Number of disk tables

 52557                                  ;============================================================================
 52558                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52559                                  ;============================================================================
 52560                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 52561                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 52562                                  
 52563                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 52564                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52565                                  
 52566                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52567                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 52568                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 52569                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52570                                  ;
 52571                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52572                                  ; describing that data item.
 52573                                  
 52574                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52575                                  
 52576                                  ;
 52577                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 52578                                  ;
 52579                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 52580                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 52581                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 52582                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 52583                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 52584                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 52585                                  ;
 52586                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 52587                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 52588                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 52589                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 52590                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 52591                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 52592                                  ;   as EOF).
 52593                                  
 52594                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 52595                                  
 52596                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 52597                                  
 52598                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 52599 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 52600 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 52601                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 52602 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 52603                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 52604 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 52605                                  
 52606                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 52607                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 52608                                  ; console.
 52609                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 52610 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 52611 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 52612                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 52613 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 52614 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 52615                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 52616 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 52617 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 52618 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 52619                                  switch_character:
 52620 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 52621 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 52622 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 52623 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 52624 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name

 52816                                  	;EVEN
 52817                                  align 2				; needed to maintain offsets

 52834                                  ;============================================================================
 52835                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52836                                  ;============================================================================
 52837                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52838                                  
 52839                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 52840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 52841                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 52842                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 52843                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 52844                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 52845                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 52846                                  ; **********************************************************
 52847                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 52848                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 52849                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 52850                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 52851                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 52852                                  ; **********************************************************	
 52853                                  
 52854                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 52855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52856                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52857                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 52858                                  
 52859                                  ; 	ORG     0
 52860                                  
 52861                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 52862                                  
 52863                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 52864                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 52865 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 52866 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 52867                                  
 52868                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 52869                                  
 52870                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 52871                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 52872 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 52873                                  RENBUF:	
 52874 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 52875                                  
 52876                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 52877                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 52878 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 52879                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 52880 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 52881                                  
 52882                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 52883                                   
 52884                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 52885                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 52886                                  
 52887                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 52888                                  
 52889                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 52890                                  
 52891                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 52892                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 52893                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 52894                                  
 52895                                  NAME1:	
 52896 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 52897                                  NAME2:
 52898 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 52899                                  DESTSTART:
 52900 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 52901                                          ;DB	((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 52902                                  	;times	5  db	0
 52903 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 52904                                  
 52905                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 52906                                  
 52907 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 52908                                  EXTFCB:	
 52909 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 52910                                  SATTRIB:
 52911 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 52912                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 52913 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 52914                                  FOUNDDEL:
 52915 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 52916                                  FOUND_DEV:
 52917 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 52918                                  FSPLICE:
 52919 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 52920                                  FSHARING:
 52921 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 52922                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 52923 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 52924 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 52925 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 52926                                  THISDRV:
 52927 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 52928                                  CLUSFAC:
 52929 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 52930                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 52931 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 52932                                  INSMODE:
 52933 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 52934 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 52935 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 52936                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 52937 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...
 52938                                  	; 24/03/2024	 
 52939 0000057D 00                      	db	0   ; PCDOS 7.1 - DOSDATA:057Dh

 53447                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 53448                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53449                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 53450                                  
 53451                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53452                                  ;
 53453                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 53454                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 53455                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 53456                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 53457                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 53458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53459                                  ; Example:
 53460                                  
 53461                                  MAP_CASE:
 53462                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 53463                                  
 53464 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 53465                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53466                                  	;RETF
 53467                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53468                                  	;;;
 53469 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53470                                  	;;;
 53471                                  Map1:
 53472 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 53473 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 53474 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 53475 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 53476                                  FINISH:
 53477 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 53478 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 53479 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 53480 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 53481 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 53482                                  L_RET:	
 53483 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 53484                                  
 53485                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 53486                                  
 53487                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53488

 53814                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 53815                                  ; 
 53816                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 53817                                  ;
 53818                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 53819                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 53820                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 53821                                  ;
 53822                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 53823                                  ;
 53824                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 53825                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 53826                                  ;
 53827                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 53828                                  ;
 53829                                  ;############################################################################
 53830                                  
 53831                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 53832                                  
 53833                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53834                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53835                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 53836                                  
 53837                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53838                                  ;
 53839                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 53840                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 53841                                  ;
 53842                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 53843                                  ;
 53844                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 53845                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 53846                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 53847                                  ;
 53848                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53849                                  
 53850                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 53851                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 53852                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 53853                                  ;ELSE
 53854                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 53855                                  ;ENDIF
 53856                                  ;ENDM
 53857

 54210                                  
 54211                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54212                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 54213                                  ;
 54214                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 54215                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 54216                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 54217                                  ;
 54218                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 54219                                  ;
 54220                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 54221                                  ;
 54222                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54223                                  
 54224 00000F5D 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 54225 00000F63 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 54226 00000F65 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 54227 00000F6A CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 54228                                  
 54229                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54230                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 54231                                  ;
 54232                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 54233                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 54234                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 54235                                  ;
 54236                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 54239 00000F71 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 54240 00000F73 BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack

 54309                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54310                                  ;
 54311                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 54312                                  ;
 54313                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 54314                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 54315                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 54316                                  ;
 54317                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 54318                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 54319                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 54320                                  ;	   4. else 
 54321                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 54322                                  ;	   6. endif
 54323                                  ;	7. else
 54324                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 54325                                  ;	9. endif
 54326                                  ;
 54327                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54328                                  
 54329                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 54330                                  
 54331                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54332                                  
 54333                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54334                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 54335                                  
 54336                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54337                                  ;
 54338                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 54339                                  ;
 54340                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54341                                  
 54342                                  ldivov:
 54343                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54344                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54345                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54346                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54347                                  i0patch:
 54348 00000F9E EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 54349                                  
 54350 00000FA0 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54351                                  divov_cont:
 54352 00000FA3 2EFF2E[7A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 54353                                  
 54354                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54355                                  ;
 54356                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 54357                                  ;
 54358                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 54359                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 54360                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 54361                                  ; will be restored then.
 54362                                  ;
 54363                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54364                                  
 54365                                  lquit:
 54366                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54367                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54368                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54369                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54370                                  i20patch:
 54371 00000FA8 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 54372                                  
 54373 00000FAA E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54374                                  quit_cont:
 54375 00000FAD 2EFF2E[7E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 54376                                  
 54377                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54378                                  ;
 54379                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 54380                                  ;
 54381                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54382                                  
 54383                                  lcommand:
 54384                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54385                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54386                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54387                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54388                                  i21patch:
 54389 00000FB2 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 54390                                  
 54391 00000FB4 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54392                                  command_cont:
 54393 00000FB7 2EFF2E[820F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 54394                                  
 54395                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54396                                  ;
 54397                                  ; INT 25h
 54398                                  ;
 54399                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54400                                  
 54401                                  labsdrd:
 54402                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54403                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54404                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54405                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54406                                  i25patch:
 54407 00000FBC EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 54408                                  
 54409 00000FBE E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54410                                  absdrd_cont:
 54411 00000FC1 2EFF2E[860F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 54412

 54414                                  ;
 54415                                  ; INT 26h
 54416                                  ;
 54417                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54418                                  
 54419                                  labsdwrt:
 54420                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54421                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54422                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54423                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54424                                  i26patch:
 54425 00000FC6 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 54426

 54428                                  absdwrt_cont:
 54429 00000FCB 2EFF2E[8A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 54430

 54434                                  ;
 54435                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54436

 54439                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54440                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54441                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54442                                  i27patch:

 54446                                  sr_cont:

 54448

 54450                                  ;
 54451                                  ; INT 2Fh
 54452                                  ;
 54453                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54454                                  
 54455                                  lint2f:
 54456                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54457                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54458                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54459                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54460                                  i2fpatch:
 54461 00000FDA EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 54462

 54464                                  int2f_cont:

 54472

 54475                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is

 54478                                  cpmpatch:

 54480                                  
 54481 00000FE6 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54482                                  callentry_cont:
 54483 00000FE9 2EFF2E[960F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 54484                                  
 54485                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54486                                  
 54487                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54488                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54489                                  %if 0
 54490                                  
 54491                                  lirett:
 54492                                  	iret
 54493                                  
 54494                                  %endif
 54495                                  
 54496                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54497                                  ;
 54498                                  ; LowIntXX:
 54499                                  ;
 54500                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 54501                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 54502                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 54503                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 54504                                  ;
 54505                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 54506                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 54507                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 54508                                  ;
 54509                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 54510                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 54511                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 54512                                  ;
 54513                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54514                                  
 54515                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54516                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 54517                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 54518                                  
 54519 00000FEE 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 54520 00000FF2 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 54521                                  
 54522                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54523                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54524                                  %if 0
 54525                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 54526                                  %endif
 54527                                  
 54528                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 54529                                  LowInt23:
 54530                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54531                                  					; the stack
 54532 00000FF6 2E8F06[EE0F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 54533 00000FFB 2E8F06[F00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 54534                                  
 54535 00001000 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 54536                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54537                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54538                                  
 54539 00001002 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54540                                  
 54541 00001005 2EFF2E[EE0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 54542                                  
 54543                                  
 54544                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 54545                                  LowInt24:
 54546                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54547                                  					; the stack
 54548 0000100A 2E8F06[F20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 54549 0000100F 2E8F06[F40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 54550                                  
 54551 00001014 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 54552                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54553                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54554                                  
 54555 00001016 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54556                                  
 54557 00001019 2EFF2E[F20F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 54558                                  
 54559                                  
 54560                                   
 54561                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 54562                                  LowInt28:
 54563 0000101E CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 54564                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54565                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54566                                  
 54567 00001020 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54568                                  
 54569 00001023 CB                      	retf
 54570                                  
 54571                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54572                                  
 54573                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54574                                  ;
 54575                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 54576                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 54577                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 54578                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 54579                                  ;
 54580                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 54581                                  
 54582                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54583                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 54584                                  
 54585                                  disa20_xfer:
 54586 00001024 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 54587                                  
 54588                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 54589                                  
 54590                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 54591                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 54592                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 54593                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 54594                                  
 54595 00001027 FA                      	cli
 54596 00001028 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 54597                                  
 54598                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54599                                  	;;;
 54600 0000102E 36C606[B812]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 54601                                  	;;;
 54602                                  
 54603 00001034 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 54604 00001036 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 54605 00001038 FB                      	sti
 54606                                  
 54607 00001039 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 54608 0000103A 56                      	push	SI
 54609 0000103B 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 54610 0000103D 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 54611 0000103F 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 54612 00001041 CB                      	retf
 54613                                  
 54614                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54615                                  ;
 54616                                  ; M003:
 54617                                  ;
 54618                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 54619                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 54620                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 54621                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 54622                                  ; more info.
 54623                                  ;
 54624                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 54625                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 54626                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 54627                                  ;
 54628                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54629                                  
 54630                                  disa20_iret:
 54631 00001042 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 54632 00001045 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 54633                                  
 54634                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54635                                  	;;;
 54636 00001049 FE0E[B812]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 54637                                  	;;;
 54638                                  
 54639 0000104D 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 54640 00001051 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 54641 00001055 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 54642                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 54643 00001057 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 54644                                  	
 54645                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54646                                  %if 0
 54647                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 54648                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 54649                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 54650                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 54651                                  %else
 54652                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54653                                  	;;;
 54654                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 54655 0000105A C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 54656 0000105E 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 54657 00001062 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 54658                                  	;;;
 54659                                  %endif
 54660 00001065 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 54661 00001066 5B                      	pop	BX
 54662 00001067 59                      	pop	CX
 54663 00001068 5A                      	pop	DX
 54664 00001069 5E                      	pop	SI
 54665 0000106A 5F                      	pop	DI
 54666 0000106B 5D                      	pop	BP
 54667 0000106C 1F                      	pop	DS
 54668 0000106D 07                      	pop	ES
 54669                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54670 0000106E CF                      	iret
 54671                                  
 54672                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54673                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 54674                                  ;
 54675                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 54676                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54677                                  ;
 54678                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 54679                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 54680                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 54681                                  ;
 54682                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54683                                  
 54684                                  XMMDisableA20:
 54685 0000106F 53                      	push	bx
 54686 00001070 50                      	push	ax
 54687                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 54688 00001071 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 54689 00001073 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54690 00001078 58                      	pop	ax

 54708                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54709                                  ;
 54710                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 54711                                  ;
 54712                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 54713                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54714                                  ;
 54715                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 54716                                  ;
 54717                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 54718                                  ;		
 54719                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 54720                                  ;
 54721                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54722                                  
 54723                                  ; 19/09/2023
 54724                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 54725                                  ;	dw	00080h
 54726                                  ;	dw	00000h
 54727                                  ;
 54728                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 54729                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 54730                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 54731                                  
 54732                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54733                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 54734                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 54735                                  
 54736                                  EnsureA20ON:
 54737 00001085 9C                      	pushf
 54738 00001086 1E                      	push    ds
 54739 00001087 06                      	push	es
 54740 00001088 51                      	push	cx
 54741 00001089 56                      	push	si
 54742 0000108A 57                      	push	di
 54743                                  
 54744                                  	; 19/09/2023
 54745                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 54746                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 54747                                  
 54748                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 54749                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54750                                  	;;;
 54751 0000108B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 54752 0000108D 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 54753 0000108F 4E                      	dec	si
 54754 00001090 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 54755 00001093 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 54756 00001095 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 54757                                  	;;;	
 54758                                  
 54759 00001098 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 54760 0000109B FC                      	cld
 54761 0000109C F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 54762                                  
 54763 0000109E 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 54764                                  EA20_RET:
 54765 000010A0 5F                      	pop	di
 54766 000010A1 5E                      	pop	si
 54767 000010A2 59                      	pop	cx
 54768 000010A3 07                      	pop	es
 54769 000010A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 54770 000010A5 9D                      	popf
 54771 000010A6 C3                      	retn
 54772                                  
 54773                                  EA20_OFF:
 54774                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 54775                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 54776                                  
 54777 000010A7 53                      	push	bx
 54778 000010A8 50                      	push	ax
 54779                                  
 54780                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54781                                  %if 0
 54782                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 54783                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 54784                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54785                                  	mov	ax,cs
 54786                                  	mov	ss,ax
 54787                                  %else
 54788                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54789                                  	;;;
 54790 000010A9 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 54791 000010AB 2E8C16[9A0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 54792 000010B0 2E8926[9C0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54793 000010B5 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 54794                                  	;;;
 54795                                  %endif
 54796 000010B7 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 54797                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 54798                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 54799 000010BA B405                    	mov	ah,5
 54800 000010BC 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54801 000010C1 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 54802 000010C3 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 54803                                  
 54804                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 54805                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 54806                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54807                                  	;;;

 54809                                  	;;;
 54810 000010CA 2E8B26[9C0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 54811                                  
 54812 000010CF 58                      	pop	ax
 54813 000010D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 54814                                  
 54815 000010D1 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 54816                                  
 54817                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 54818 000010D3 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 54819 000010D5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54820 000010D7 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 54821 000010D9 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 54822                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 54823                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text

 54827                                  	;;;

 54830                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 54831                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0

 54835                                  	;;;
 54836 000010E3 CD10                    	int	10h
 54837                                  	
 54838 000010E5 BE[1312]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 54839 000010E8 0E                      	push	cs
 54840 000010E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 54841 000010EA FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 54842                                  XMMprnt:

 55271                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 55272                                  ;
 55273                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 55274                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 55275                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can.

 55291                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55292                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah

 55294                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55295                                  
 55296                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 55297                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 55298                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 55299                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 55300                                  
 55301                                  ; country and code page information
 55302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55303                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 55304 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 55305 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 55305 0000123B 53595300           
 55306                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 55307 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 55308                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55309                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55310                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 55311                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 55312                                  ;  endif
 55313                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 55314                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 55315                                  ;  endif
 55316                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 55317                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 55318                                  ;  endif
 55319                                  ;else
 55320 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 55321                                  ;endif
 55322                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55323 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 55324                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 55325 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 55326 00001277 [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 55327 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55328 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 55329 0000127C [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 55330 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55331 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 55332 00001281 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 55333 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55334 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 55335 00001286 [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 55336 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter

 55338 0000128B [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 55339 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 55340 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 55341 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size

 55344                                  ;	......
 55345                                  ;else

 55350 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 55351                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108

 55354 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator

 55660                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 55661                                  ;

 55671                                  ;	    jmp l0
 55672                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 55673                                  
 55674                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 55675                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 55676                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 55677                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 55678                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 55679                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 55680                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 55681                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 55682                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 55683                                  
 55684                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55685                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55686                                  
 55687                                  ; 06/12/2022
 55688                                  ;DOSDATASIZE	equ  $ - DOSDATASTART ; 4962 bytes (1362h)
 55689                                  
 55690                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 55691                                  
 55692                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55693                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
 55694                                  
 55695                                  ;============================================================================
 55696                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 55697                                  ;============================================================================
 55698                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 55699                                  
 55700                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 55701                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 55702                                  ;
 55703                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 55704                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 55705                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 55706                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 55707                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 55708                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 55709                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 55710                                  ; to call out here.
 55711                                  ;
 55712                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 55713                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 55714                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 55715                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 55716                                  ;
 55717                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 55718                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 55719                                  ;
 55720                                  ;Exported Functions
 55721                                  ;==================
 55722                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 55723                                  
 55724                                  ; DosData Segment
 55725                                  
 55726                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55727                                  
 55728                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55729                                  
 55730                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 55731                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 55732                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 55733                                  ; 'patch' related.
 55734                                  
 55735                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 55736 0000133E 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 55737                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55738                                  
 55739                                  ; 25/03/2024
 55740                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 55741                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 55742                                  
 55743                                  MagicPatch:
 55744                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 55745 00001340 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 55746 00001341 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 55747 00001342 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 55748 00001343 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 55749 00001344 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 55750 00001345 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 55751                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 55752                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 55753                                  
 55754                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55755                                  
 55756                                  ;DosData Ends
 55757                                  
 55758                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 55759                                  ;
 55760                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55761                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 55762                                  
 55763                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 55764                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 55765                                  
 55766                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 55767                                  
 55768                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55769                                  
 55770                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 55771                                  
 55772                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 55773                                  
 55774                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55775                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 55776                                  
 55777                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 55778                                  
 55779                                  ;align 16
 55780                                  
 55781                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 55782                                  
 55783                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55784                                  
 55785                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55786                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 55787                                  
 55788                                  ; 05/12/2022
 55789                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 55790                                  
 55791                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 55792                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55793                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 55794                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 55795                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 55796                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 55797                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
 55798                                  ;DOSDATALAST ENDS
